+1 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal.name: +1 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal
+1 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal.description: This item crystallizes the focus needed to replicate the actions of a star. Attack rolls with solar weapons gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can benefit from one orbital crystal.

+2 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal.name: +2 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal
+2 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal.description: This item crystallizes the focus needed to replicate the actions of a star. Attack rolls with solar weapons gain a +2 item bonus, and the weapon can benefit from two orbital crystals.

+3 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal.name: +3 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal
+3 Weapon Potency Solarian Crystal.description: This item crystallizes the focus needed to replicate the actions of a star. Attack rolls with solar weapons gain a +3 item bonus, and the weapon can benefit from three orbital crystals.

Abadarcorp Travel Suit.name: Abadarcorp Travel Suit
Abadarcorp Travel Suit.description:
Upgrades: 2

AbadarCorp executives popularized these armored business suits for boardrooms and diplomatic meetings. Contingent force fields and concealed plating protect the wearer in hostile situations. Higher grades of travel suits offer more protection—along with a designer label.

Acid Dart Rifle.name: Acid Dart Rifle
Acid Dart Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This rifle uses compressed air to shoot tiny, chambered darts loaded with components for a highly corrosive compound that remains separated until launched, allowing for nearly unlimited shelf life with minimal risk of accidental exposure.

Active Camouflage (Advanced).name: Active Camouflage (Advanced)
Active Camouflage (Advanced).description: This armor is equipped with electronic ink that changes the appearance of your armor using shifting patterns that respond to your environment. You gain a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

Active Camouflage (Commercial).name: Active Camouflage (Commercial)
Active Camouflage (Commercial).description: This armor is equipped with electronic ink that changes the appearance of your armor using shifting patterns that respond to your environment. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

Active Camouflage (Tactical).name: Active Camouflage (Tactical)
Active Camouflage (Tactical).description: This armor is equipped with electronic ink that changes the appearance of your armor using shifting patterns that respond to your environment. You gain a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.

Adaptive Energy Shielding.name: Adaptive Energy Shielding
Adaptive Energy Shielding.description:
This device fuses magic and technology to detect and change the chemical composition of the insulation installed on your armor, allowing it to react to different sources of energy damage.

Activate—Adapt r

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger You take acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage

Effect Your energy shielding upgrade changes from one energy type to another. This lasts until you Activate this upgrade again or if either upgrade is removed. If you have multiple instances of energy shielding on the same armor, choose one to adapt when you use this reaction.

Aegis Series.name: Aegis Series
Aegis Series.description:
Upgrades: 0

Aegis armor is a starmetal-infused suit that encases its wearer entirely, including an attached visorless helmet. Sensors built into the suit feed sensory information to the wearer, and powered limbs aid maneuvers. Movement in an aegis suit is clumsy, but powerful.

Aeon Rifle.name: Aeon Rifle
Aeon Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 0

A mainstay of the Azlanti Star Empire, this sleek laser rifle includes a slot for aeon stones to enhance and focus the intensity of its beams.

Aeon Stone (Cloudy Blue Rhomboid).name: Aeon Stone (Cloudy Blue Rhomboid)
Aeon Stone (Cloudy Blue Rhomboid).description:
Staple items within the Azlanti Star Empire, these stones are sought across the cosmos for their connection with the building of the known universe. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head (or another visible part of your anatomy if you don't have a head) instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into specific items, such as weapons with the aeon trait or long-lost magical items called wayfinders.

This deep-blue prism with cloudy inclusions is light as a feather. Its resonant power gives you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

Activate—Fly Free 3 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain a fly Speed for 1 minute equal to your Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Aeon Stone (Iridescent Spindle).name: Aeon Stone (Iridescent Spindle)
Aeon Stone (Iridescent Spindle).description:
Staple items within the Azlanti Star Empire, these stones are sought across the cosmos for their connection with the building of the known universe. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head (or another visible part of your anatomy if you don't have a head) instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into specific items, such as weapons with the aeon trait or long-lost magical items called wayfinders.

This nacreous tapered cylinder provides a breath of air when you need it most. You can hold your breath for twice as long and you gain a +1 item bonus to saves against inhaled poisons.

The resonant power allows you to cast life seal as a divine innate spell once per day.

Aeon Stone (Kaleidoscopic Icosahedron).name: Aeon Stone (Kaleidoscopic Icosahedron)
Aeon Stone (Kaleidoscopic Icosahedron).description:
Staple items within the Azlanti Star Empire, these stones are sought across the cosmos for their connection with the building of the known universe. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head (or another visible part of your anatomy if you don't have a head) instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into specific items, such as weapons with the aeon trait or long-lost magical items called wayfinders.

This gold star glitters with joyful energy. The resonant power allows you to cast guidance as an occult innate cantrip.

Activate—Cosmic Luck 3 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Trigger You critically fail an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check

Effect You change the critical failure into a failure.

Aeon Stone (Sapphire Cone).name: Aeon Stone (Sapphire Cone)
Aeon Stone (Sapphire Cone).description:
Staple items within the Azlanti Star Empire, these stones are sought across the cosmos for their connection with the building of the known universe. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head (or another visible part of your anatomy if you don't have a head) instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into specific items, such as weapons with the aeon trait or long-lost magical items called wayfinders.

This opalescent sapphire cone grants you a limited form of projected empathy with a range of 100 feet that can be roughly understood by creatures regardless of language, and includes a type and intensity of emotion, such as "mild anger," "intense joy," or "deep sadness." When you Sense the Motive of a creature within 30 feet, you detect the presence or absence of thoughts from the creature as though you cast the 1-action version of detect thoughts.

The resonant power allows you to cast mind skewer as an occult innate spell once per day.

Aeon Stone (Sky Blue Helix).name: Aeon Stone (Sky Blue Helix)
Aeon Stone (Sky Blue Helix).description:
Staple items within the Azlanti Star Empire, these stones are sought across the cosmos for their connection with the building of the known universe. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to construct the universe in primeval times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head (or another visible part of your anatomy if you don't have a head) instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are suppressed until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into specific items, such as weapons with the aeon trait or long-lost magical items called wayfinders.

This sky-blue helicoid prism guides your innate sense of direction in even the emptiest reaches of space. You gain a +2 item bonus to Piloting checks to Navigate. The resonant power allows you to cast seek the stars as a divine innate cantrip.

Activate—Navigate 1 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You concentrate on a Drift beacon you have visited before and mentally chart a course for that location. You immediately know which direction to travel to reach your destination, and your journey takes 1 day less if you're piloting the ship.

Akashic Lens (Advanced).name: Akashic Lens (Advanced)
Akashic Lens (Advanced).description:
Worn as a contact lens, spectacles, or other eyewear, these magically treated lenses project a special data display that uses rudimentary AI and rapid eye tracking to quickly cycle through information until you find what you want to know. It grants you a +2 item bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks made with the skill chosen when you use Database Scan.

Activate—Database Scan 2

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The lens casts a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.bHQ8Y4XZfUa2UEno] that uses the lens instead of a comm unit.

Akashic Lens (Commercial).name: Akashic Lens (Commercial)
Akashic Lens (Commercial).description:
Worn as a contact lens, spectacles, or other eyewear, these magically treated lenses project a special data display that uses rudimentary AI and rapid eye tracking to quickly cycle through information until you find what you want to know. It grants you a +1 item bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks made with the skill chosen when you use Database Scan.

Activate—Database Scan 2

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The lens casts a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.bHQ8Y4XZfUa2UEno] that uses the lens instead of a comm unit.

Akashic Lens (Tactical).name: Akashic Lens (Tactical)
Akashic Lens (Tactical).description:
Worn as a contact lens, spectacles, or other eyewear, these magically treated lenses project a special data display that uses rudimentary AI and rapid eye tracking to quickly cycle through information until you find what you want to know. It grants you a +1 item bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks made with the skill chosen when you use Database Scan.

Activate—Database Scan 2

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The lens casts a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.bHQ8Y4XZfUa2UEno] that uses the lens instead of a comm unit.

Alert Sensor (Advanced).name: Alert Sensor (Advanced)
Alert Sensor (Advanced).description: This metal sphere unfolds when activated, revealing an array of antennae and blinking lights. A commercial alert sensor monitors changes in temperature and vibration in a 10-foot radius around the sensor. Whenever a corporeal creature enters the sensor's area, it emits an alert. When you set up the sensor, you can choose whether the alert is an audible ping or an inaudible private alert to a comm unit (such as the one in your armor). The alert wakes up any creatures that can hear it. A tactical alert sensor comes with a connected app that transmits alerts to your comm unit up to 3 miles away, and an advanced alert sensor transmits alerts to your comm unit at a planetary range.

Alert Sensor (Commercial).name: Alert Sensor (Commercial)
Alert Sensor (Commercial).description: This metal sphere unfolds when activated, revealing an array of antennae and blinking lights. A commercial alert sensor monitors changes in temperature and vibration in a 10-foot radius around the sensor. Whenever a corporeal creature enters the sensor's area, it emits an alert. When you set up the sensor, you can choose whether the alert is an audible ping or an inaudible private alert to a comm unit (such as the one in your armor). The alert wakes up any creatures that can hear it. A tactical alert sensor comes with a connected app that transmits alerts to your comm unit up to 3 miles away, and an advanced alert sensor transmits alerts to your comm unit at a planetary range.

Alert Sensor (Tactical).name: Alert Sensor (Tactical)
Alert Sensor (Tactical).description: This metal sphere unfolds when activated, revealing an array of antennae and blinking lights. A commercial alert sensor monitors changes in temperature and vibration in a 10-foot radius around the sensor. Whenever a corporeal creature enters the sensor's area, it emits an alert. When you set up the sensor, you can choose whether the alert is an audible ping or an inaudible private alert to a comm unit (such as the one in your armor). The alert wakes up any creatures that can hear it. A tactical alert sensor comes with a connected app that transmits alerts to your comm unit up to 3 miles away, and an advanced alert sensor transmits alerts to your comm unit at a planetary range.

Animated Intelligence (Commercial).name: Animated Intelligence (Commercial)
Animated Intelligence (Commercial).description:
Billed as the pinnacle of military artificial intelligence, animated intelligence allows a rudimentary artificial intelligence to magically command a weapon to fight. However, veterans can easily point out the distinct patterns and errors that make it clear the technology has yet to achieve true intelligence.

Activate—Set Free 1 (concentrate, manipulate)

Effect You Release the weapon and it flutters through the air, fighting on its own against the last enemy you attacked, or the nearest enemy to it if your target has been defeated. At the end of your turn each round, the weapon can Fly up to its fly Speed of 30 feet, and then can either Fly again or Strike one creature within its range or reach.

The weapon has a space of 5 feet, but it doesn't block or impede enemies attempting to move though that space, nor does it benefit from or provide flanking. The animated weapon is considered a technological creature for the purpose of effects that can target it. The weapon can't move through an enemy's space. The weapon can't use reactions, and its Fly actions don't trigger reactions.

While it's activated, an animated weapon makes Strikes with an attack modifier of +18 plus its item bonus to attack rolls. It uses the weapon's normal damage but has a +0 Strength and Dexterity modifier. The weapon's abilities that automatically trigger on a hit or critical hit still function, but the weapon can't be activated or benefit from any of your abilities while animated.

Each round, when the weapon finishes using its actions, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:6]. On a failure, the activation ends. The weapon falls to the ground and can't be Set Free again for 10 minutes.

Animated Intelligence (Tactical).name: Animated Intelligence (Tactical)
Animated Intelligence (Tactical).description:
Billed as the pinnacle of military artificial intelligence, animated intelligence allows a rudimentary artificial intelligence to magically command a weapon to fight. However, veterans can easily point out the distinct patterns and errors that make it clear the technology has yet to achieve true intelligence.

Activate—Set Free 1 (concentrate, manipulate)

Effect You Release the weapon and it flutters through the air, fighting on its own against the last enemy you attacked, or the nearest enemy to it if your target has been defeated. At the end of your turn each round, the weapon can Fly up to its fly Speed of 50 feet, and then can either Fly again or Strike one creature within its range or reach.

The weapon has a space of 5 feet, but it doesn't block or impede enemies attempting to move though that space, nor does it benefit from or provide flanking. The animated weapon is considered a technological creature for the purpose of effects that can target it. The weapon can't move through an enemy's space. The weapon can't use reactions, and its Fly actions don't trigger reactions.

While it's activated, an animated weapon makes Strikes with an attack modifier of +27 plus its item bonus to attack rolls. It uses the weapon's normal damage but has a +0 Strength and Dexterity modifier. The weapon's abilities that automatically trigger on a hit or critical hit still function, but the weapon can't be activated or benefit from any of your abilities while animated.

Each round, when the weapon finishes using its actions, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5]. On a failure, the activation ends. The weapon falls to the ground and can't be Set Free again for 10 minutes.

Antigrav Harness (Advanced).name: Antigrav Harness (Advanced)
Antigrav Harness (Advanced).description:
This convoluted web of synthweave straps is worn as a fashion statement in some subcultures but has a useful application in extreme environments. You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, and you aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Gravity Alteration 1 (manipulate)

Effect You treat gravity as being one or two steps higher or lower (for example, zero-g becomes low gravity, low gravity becomes standard, standard gravity becomes high gravity, and high gravity becomes extreme gravity, or vice versa). This only affects you, your gear, and your movement and lasts 1 minute.

Antigrav Harness (Commercial).name: Antigrav Harness (Commercial)
Antigrav Harness (Commercial).description:
This convoluted web of synthweave straps is worn as a fashion statement in some subcultures but has a useful application in extreme environments. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, and you aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Gravity Alteration 1 (manipulate)

Effect You treat gravity as being one step higher or lower (for example, zero-g becomes low gravity, low gravity becomes standard, standard gravity becomes high gravity, and high gravity becomes extreme gravity, or vice versa). This only affects you, your gear, and your movement and lasts until the end of your next turn.

Antigrav Harness (Tactical).name: Antigrav Harness (Tactical)
Antigrav Harness (Tactical).description:
This convoluted web of synthweave straps is worn as a fashion statement in some subcultures but has a useful application in extreme environments. You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks, and you aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Gravity Alteration 1 (manipulate)

Effect You treat gravity as being one step higher or lower (for example, zero-g becomes low gravity, low gravity becomes standard, standard gravity becomes high gravity, and high gravity becomes extreme gravity, or vice versa). This only affects you, your gear, and your movement and lasts 1 minute.

Antimagic Marrow.name: Antimagic Marrow
Antimagic Marrow.description:
Your bone marrow is infused with potent components extracted from magic-resistant creatures. You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects.

Activate—Resist Magic 1 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You attempt to counteract a single magical effect currently affecting you. This has the effect of a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG] spell and a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}. You can use this activation as a reaction when a spell targets you or includes you in its effect, but if you do, you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on your following turn as you recover from the surge of antimagic energies.

Arc Emitter.name: Arc Emitter
Arc Emitter.description:
Upgrades: 1

Composed of two four-foot-long protracting rails, this weapon generates arcs of electricity emitted safely away from its wielder.

Arc Pistol.name: Arc Pistol
Arc Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

Instead of traditional ammunition, this bulky pistol contains a capacitor that generates arcs of electricity. Its stock is crafted from polycarbon or other synthetic insulators, often tinted bright yellow and inscribed with the universal bolt symbol for high voltage.

Arc Rifle.name: Arc Rifle
Arc Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This rifle’s oversized body contains a larger version of an arc pistol capacitor, with a short barrel and polycarbon stock designed to insulate the wielder from high voltage. The arc rifle’s larger capacitor allows it to produce a charge with enough power to subdue a rampaging renkroda.

Archaic Text.name: Archaic Text
Archaic Text.description: This book is a printed manuscript and could be a religious text, a book of ancient recipes, a romance novel, or vintage mechanical schematics.

Armored Coat.name: Armored Coat
Armored Coat.description:
Upgrades: 1

This overcoat is made of real or synthetic leather and reinforced with armored plates. Armored coats are often tailor-made to match the wearer's personal style. Standard versions are issued to military officers as part of their uniforms.

Artificial Immortalizer.name: Artificial Immortalizer
Artificial Immortalizer.description:
This extra organ assimilates with and enhances your circulatory and immune systems. When you succeed at a Fortitude save against an ongoing disease or poison, you recover completely, regardless of its current stage. When you get this augmentation, you either increase your Constitution modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value.

Activate—Life Buffer 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain 50 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

Artillery Laser.name: Artillery Laser
Artillery Laser.description:
Upgrades: 1

The fast-firing and continuous beams of this laser cannon converge on the target to create enough heat to melt a steel door into slag.

Assassin Rifle.name: Assassin Rifle
Assassin Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This sniper rifle breaks down into smaller parts, allowing its wielder to smuggle the weapon without attracting attention. Most assassin rifles are equipped with powerful scopes and digital sights.

Aucturnite Chakram.name: Aucturnite Chakram
Aucturnite Chakram.description:
Upgrades: 1

This bladed hoop is carved from a chunk of Aucturn and sculpted to resemble a planet's ring. The material has been found throughout the Pact Worlds and beyond, mysteriously appearing lightyears from Aucturn's original orbit.

Auto-CPR Unit.name: Auto-CPR Unit
Auto-CPR Unit.description: This device monitors your vital signs, including blood pressure, heart rate, respiration, and temperature. When one or more of these vital signs falls below an acceptable level, the device automatically administers aid, injecting you with stimulants and applying resuscitating pressure to your organs if necessary. When you have the dying condition while wearing this armor, the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 8 + your dying value (instead of 10 + your dying value).

Autodreamer.name: Autodreamer
Autodreamer.description: A microchip in your brain partially activates your dorsolateral prefrontal cortex while you sleep, immersing you in constant lucid dreams unless you choose to sleep normally. Once per day when you awaken after getting a full 8 hours of sleep, you count as having spent a day of downtime retraining. Your dreams draw from your own experience, so you can't use them for retraining that requires an instructor or specialized knowledge.

Autograppler (Commercial).name: Autograppler (Commercial)
Autograppler (Commercial).description: You can attach this anchoring device to a cable line with an Interact action. Clamps automatically slide from the base of the autograppler along the attached cable, allowing it to be climbed like a knotted rope. You can throw the autograppler to attach it to a solid surface, attempting a ranged attack roll using your simple weapon proficiency against a DC depending on the target, typically at least DC 20. This attack has the secret trait. On a success, your autograppler has a firm hold, but on a critical failure, the grappler seems like it will hold but it detaches when you're partway up. A tactical autograppler has a sensor to detect whether it has a firm hold, causing it to automatically retract if you critically fail your ranged attack to attach it.

Autograppler (Tactical).name: Autograppler (Tactical)
Autograppler (Tactical).description: You can attach this anchoring device to a cable line with an Interact action. Clamps automatically slide from the base of the autograppler along the attached cable, allowing it to be climbed like a knotted rope. You can throw the autograppler to attach it to a solid surface, attempting a ranged attack roll using your simple weapon proficiency against a DC depending on the target, typically at least DC 20. This attack has the secret trait. On a success, your autograppler has a firm hold, but on a critical failure, the grappler seems like it will hold but it detaches when you're partway up. A tactical autograppler has a sensor to detect whether it has a firm hold, causing it to automatically retract if you critically fail your ranged attack to attach it.

Autorecognition Lens.name: Autorecognition Lens
Autorecognition Lens.description: An artificial eye lens microscopically wired to your temporal lobe automatically tracks a database of associated names and faces as you meet or interact with individuals. After you've learned someone's name and appearance, a tiny HUD displays their name to you whenever you're looking at them, as long as you're aware of their presence and their appearance hasn't dramatically changed (at the GM's discretion). This doesn't help you see or identify people who are trying to hide or disguise their appearance. This augmentation doesn't count toward your implant limit.

Autotarget Rifle.name: Autotarget Rifle
Autotarget Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This short, bulky assault rifle incorporates a piston system that allows the user to switch to auto-fire and unload a magazine with one trigger squeeze.

Ballistic Missile (Advanced).name: Ballistic Missile (Advanced)
Ballistic Missile (Advanced).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(3[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion.

Ballistic Missile (Commercial).name: Ballistic Missile (Commercial)
Ballistic Missile (Commercial).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(1[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion.

Ballistic Missile (Elite).name: Ballistic Missile (Elite)
Ballistic Missile (Elite).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(4[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion (10-foot-radius).

Ballistic Missile (Paragon).name: Ballistic Missile (Paragon)
Ballistic Missile (Paragon).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(5[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion (20-foot-radius).

Ballistic Missile (Superior).name: Ballistic Missile (Superior)
Ballistic Missile (Superior).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(3[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion (10-foot-radius).

Ballistic Missile (Tactical).name: Ballistic Missile (Tactical)
Ballistic Missile (Tactical).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(2[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion.

Ballistic Missile (Ultimate).name: Ballistic Missile (Ultimate)
Ballistic Missile (Ultimate).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

This missile carries an explosive warhead that deals @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]] damage to its target and @Damage[(4[splash])[fire]] splash damage in the subsequent explosion (20-foot-radius).

Basic Environmental Protection.name: Basic Environmental Protection
Basic Environmental Protection.description: Whether using a helmet or crude forcefield, this upgrade protects the user against the vacuum of space. This armor loses the exposed trait for as long as the upgrade is installed.

Baton.name: Baton
Baton.description:
Upgrades: 1

This reinforced rod is commonly made from steel alloys and designed to strike and parry incoming blows.

Battle Ribbon.name: Battle Ribbon
Battle Ribbon.description:
Upgrades: 1

This sheer nanocarbon ribbon is sharp enough to cut through flesh without interrupting the traditional battle dances that make the weapon famous. Fabrics, precious metals, and other materials are sometimes embedded into a battle ribbon to create spectacular visual effects.

Battleglove.name: Battleglove
Battleglove.description:
Upgrades: 1

These durable gloves fit over a wielder’s hands (or other appendage) and conceal weighted plates or spikes over the knuckles (or equivalent area). While battlegloves are classified as weapons, fashionable versions easily blend in at most venues, blurring the line between accessory and armament.

Bipod.name: Bipod
Bipod.description: A bipod can be attached to powerful weapons—those with the kickback trait—to allow wielders with lower Strength to use them at the cost of mobility. You can set up the bipod with a single Interact action using one appendage, setting the bipod in your square. When using a bipod, you don't take the –2 penalty for firing a kickback weapon, even if your Strength isn't high enough to avoid the penalty. However, you must spend a single Interact action to retrieve the bipod before you can move the weapon to a different position. Deploying or retrieving a bipod with an Interact action doesn't automatically make you observed, like an Interact action normally would, so long as you don't set up or remove the bipod when it's in a spot where creatures can see the bipod itself.

Bone Scepter.name: Bone Scepter
Bone Scepter.description:
Upgrades: 1

This engraved club of solid bone is said to be tempered in specialized facilities using material from the void, allowing it to ceaselessly drain a target’s life energy with each strike.

Bone Serum.name: Bone Serum
Bone Serum.description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This tarry liquid is distilled from elebrian bone matter. Upon drinking it, you gain void healing for 1 hour.

Boom Pistol.name: Boom Pistol
Boom Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

A boom pistol resembles a megaphone with a trigger, emitting sudden bursts of sound capable of shattering bulletproof glass or rupturing organs.

Breaching Gun.name: Breaching Gun
Breaching Gun.description:
Upgrades: 1

This snub-nosed scattergun is commonly used to blast through doors and walls. About half the size of a reaction breacher, this scattergun is infamous for its mighty recoil.

Cable Line (Commercial).name: Cable Line (Commercial)
Cable Line (Commercial).description: This industrial cable is typically made of high-durability plastic coated in metal. A commercial cable line is coated in titanium alloy, while a tactical cable line is coated in adamantine alloy.

Cable Line (Tactical).name: Cable Line (Tactical)
Cable Line (Tactical).description: This industrial cable is typically made of high-durability plastic coated in metal. A commercial cable line is coated in titanium alloy, while a tactical cable line is coated in adamantine alloy.

Cairn Form Spell Amp (Commercial).name: Cairn Form Spell Amp (Commercial)
Cairn Form Spell Amp (Commercial).description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.LVTgiDmm3g9dt0Sa] spell

Cairn Form Spell Amp (Tactical).name: Cairn Form Spell Amp (Tactical)
Cairn Form Spell Amp (Tactical).description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.LVTgiDmm3g9dt0Sa]

Camping Kit.name: Camping Kit
Camping Kit.description: A camping kit contains a weatherproof tent for four Medium or two Large creatures, bedrolls, a fire igniter, 1 week of rations, and a survival knife.

Carbon Shield.name: Carbon Shield
Carbon Shield.description: This durable yet lightweight defensive plate comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, and it's often customized with LED displays that broadcast personal insignia or an organization's colors and symbols.

Carbon Skin.name: Carbon Skin
Carbon Skin.description:
Upgrades: 1

This form-fitting suit of carbon fiber encases the body. Mass-produced versions are usually dull-gray, functional garments, while pricier, bespoke suits dazzle like diamonds.

Card Slinger.name: Card Slinger
Card Slinger.description:
Upgrade: 1

This ceramic weapon sharpens and fires playing cards, such as those from a harrow deck. Their folding design and innocuous ammunition make it ideal for infiltrating secure locations, especially casinos. While the weapon often relies on lucky hits, in the hands of a gambler familiar with card trajectory, it can become a deadly weapon.

Cardiac Accelerator.name: Cardiac Accelerator
Cardiac Accelerator.description:
This implant integrates directly into your heart. You can trigger the accelerator to briefly overclock your body's cardiovascular system.

Activate—Accelerate 1

Trigger You Climb, Stride, or Swim

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect You increase your Speed by 20 feet for the triggering action.

Celebrity Serum.name: Celebrity Serum
Celebrity Serum.description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This fizzy pink concoction is mildly intoxicating and grants a +1 item bonus to Performance checks for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.JCNX5U0rHcEhraIK]{Effect: Celebrity Serum}

Cellular Stimulant Spell Amp.name: Cellular Stimulant Spell Amp
Cellular Stimulant Spell Amp.description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.gUNeahoAJMH9Uatm] spell (DC 15)

Chemalyzer.name: Chemalyzer
Chemalyzer.description: This handheld sampling unit grants a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks to identify an unknown drug, medicinal, poison, or other chemical substance.

Climbing Kit (Commercial).name: Climbing Kit (Commercial)
Climbing Kit (Commercial).description: A commercial climbing kit includes 50 feet of cable line, a grappling hook, harnesses, pulleys, pitons, a hammer, and crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit.

Climbing Kit (Tactical).name: Climbing Kit (Tactical)
Climbing Kit (Tactical).description: A commercial climbing kit includes 50 feet of cable line, a grappling hook, harnesses, pulleys, pitons, a hammer, and crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. You gain a +1 item bonus to Athletics checks to Climb while using a tactical climbing kit. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit.

Climbing Suckers (Commercial).name: Climbing Suckers (Commercial)
Climbing Suckers (Commercial).description:
The soles of your feet, palms of your hands, or the surfaces of other appropriate appendages are covered in fleshy slats that can open and close to improve your climbing grip. You gain a climb Speed based on the version of climbing suckers you have installed. You don't benefit from climbing suckers unless you leave your appendages uncovered or are wearing custom clothing.

You gain a 15-foot climb Speed as long as you're wearing light armor or no armor.

Climbing Suckers (Tactical).name: Climbing Suckers (Tactical)
Climbing Suckers (Tactical).description:
The soles of your feet, palms of your hands, or the surfaces of other appropriate appendages are covered in fleshy slats that can open and close to improve your climbing grip. You gain a climb Speed based on the version of climbing suckers you have installed. You don't benefit from climbing suckers unless you leave your appendages uncovered or are wearing custom clothing.

You gain a 15-foot climb Speed as long as you're wearing light armor or no armor.

Cloaking Device (Commercial).name: Cloaking Device (Commercial)
Cloaking Device (Commercial).description:
Incorporated flexible sheets of panels and light receptors create advanced plasma camouflage to bend light around your body and make you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}.

Activate—Adapt 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You become invisible for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB] spell.

Cloaking Device (Tactical).name: Cloaking Device (Tactical)
Cloaking Device (Tactical).description:
Incorporated flexible sheets of panels and light receptors create advanced plasma camouflage to bend light around your body and make you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}.

Activate—Adapt 1 (manipulate)

Frequency three times per day

Effect You become invisible for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB] spell.

Cognition Accelerator.name: Cognition Accelerator
Cognition Accelerator.description:
A miniature supercomputer augments your brain's ability to process information. You gain a +3 item bonus to checks to Recall Knowledge with any skill. When you get this augmentation, you either increase your Intelligence modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value. This gives you additional trained skills and languages, as normal for increasing your Intelligence modifier. You must select skills and languages when the augmentation is first installed, and they can't be changed.

Activate—Access Database 1 (concentrate)

Frequency once per hour

Effect Immediately attempt three checks to Recall Knowledge about related topics, selecting each topic after learning the results of the prior checks. For example, you could Recall Knowledge about a specific person, then their home world, then a creature or settlement on that world. If you would fail one of these checks, you succeed instead, and if you would critically fail, you instead fail normally. For these actions, you can't use any other special abilities, reactions, or free actions that trigger when you Recall Knowledge.

Comm Unit.name: Comm Unit
Comm Unit.description:
A personal comm unit is a pocket-sized device that combines a minor portable computer and a cellular communications device, allowing instantaneous wireless communication with other comm units in both audio- and text-based formats at planetary range. A personal comm unit also includes a calculator, a flashlight (emits bright light in a 5-foot radius around you and dim light in the next 5 feet), a browser that accesses any local infospheres, and several entertainment options (including games).

Personal comm units integrated into armor have some voice-activated capabilities; you can communicate with other comm units in audio-based formats and receive responses without needing a free hand, but typing a message, browsing the infosphere, or using an app requires the use of at least one hand.

Comm units that function at longer ranges aren't as portable; they include built-in generators that provide the necessary amount of power and rely on active Drift beacons to communicate. Short-term use of these units can be purchased in most major settlements.

Commando Serum.name: Commando Serum
Commando Serum.description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This tangy crimson serum grants you 1d10+5 temporary Hit Points, as well as a +5-foot item bonus to your Speed and to any climb or swim Speeds you have, for 1 minute. When you drink this serum, your veins protrude and your eyes take on a reddish tinge.

Compact Shield.name: Compact Shield
Compact Shield.description: This sleek shield is a favorite of operatives and other mobile combatants. Its most common design is a polycarbon panel contoured to fit snugly over a forearm or other limb.

Container (Designer).name: Container (Designer)
Container (Designer).description:
Containers come in a variety of styles, such as backpacks, duffel bags, briefcases, and handbags. A container holds up to 4 Bulk of items. If you're carrying or stowing the container rather than wearing it on your person, its Bulk is light instead of negligible.

You gain a +1 item bonus to checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on high society individuals while carrying a designer container, such as designer handbag.

Container (Ordinary).name: Container (Ordinary)
Container (Ordinary).description: Containers come in a variety of styles, such as backpacks, duffel bags, briefcases, and handbags. A container holds up to 4 Bulk of items. If you're carrying or stowing the container rather than wearing it on your person, its Bulk is light instead of negligible.

Cosmic Connector.name: Cosmic Connector
Cosmic Connector.description:
This augmentation opens your mind to the underlying cosmic truths of the Universe. When you get this augmentation, you either increase your Wisdom modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value.

Activate—Sift Reality 1 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You sift through the metaphysical possibilities of local reality, gaining the effects of a sift the sphere spell, except that you receive the result from your own connection to the cosmos rather than the local infosphere.

Activate—Reground in Reality 3 (concentrate, fortune)

Frequency once per hour

Trigger You fail a saving throw against an illusion

Effect The cosmic connector maintains your understanding of what's real. You can reroll the saving throw and use the better result.

Creator Capsule (Advanced).name: Creator Capsule (Advanced)
Creator Capsule (Advanced).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Creator Capsule (Commercial).name: Creator Capsule (Commercial)
Creator Capsule (Commercial).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Creator Capsule (Elite).name: Creator Capsule (Elite)
Creator Capsule (Elite).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Creator Capsule (Paragon).name: Creator Capsule (Paragon)
Creator Capsule (Paragon).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Creator Capsule (Superior).name: Creator Capsule (Superior)
Creator Capsule (Superior).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Creator Capsule (Tactical).name: Creator Capsule (Tactical)
Creator Capsule (Tactical).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Creator Capsule (Ultimate).name: Creator Capsule (Ultimate)
Creator Capsule (Ultimate).description: You can use a creator capsule with a computer to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} items much more quickly than usual using the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.feats.Item.5qfJ8RzeTe5ucjf1]{Fabricator} feat.

Crossbolter.name: Crossbolter
Crossbolter.description:
Upgrades: 1

This high-tech crossbow uses a series of pistons to propel bolts along its barrel. These quietfiring semiautomatic weapons are popular in high-density settlements where gunfire might cause a panic.

Cryopike.name: Cryopike
Cryopike.description:
Upgrades: 1

This polearm’s shaft houses rapidly circulating supercooled gas that condenses and channels endothermic energy into a cryogenic blade.

Crystal Lens (Advanced).name: Crystal Lens (Advanced)
Crystal Lens (Advanced).description:
A psychically active crystal replaces the lens of one of your eyes. You gain 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} as a constant ability. Your ability to sense psychic energies grants you a +2 item bonus to Perception checks.

Activate—Psychic X-Rays 2 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain the effects of an @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.MWguJ6RWEmmPBntb]{X-Ray Vision} spell. The detect magic of your crystal lens works through any material you can see through with this x-ray vision spell, even if you wouldn't normally have line of effect.

Crystal Lens (Commercial).name: Crystal Lens (Commercial)
Crystal Lens (Commercial).description: A psychically active crystal replaces the lens of one of your eyes. You gain 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} as a constant ability. Your ability to sense psychic energies grants you a +1 item bonus to Perception checks.

Crystal Lens (Elite).name: Crystal Lens (Elite)
Crystal Lens (Elite).description:
A psychically active crystal replaces the lens of one of your eyes. You gain 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} as a constant ability. You see the location of all auras within 30 feet, not just the strongest. Your ability to sense psychic energies grants you a +2 item bonus to Perception checks.

Activate—Psychic X-Rays 2 (concentrate)

Frequency twice per day

Effect You gain the effects of an x-ray vision spell. The detect magic of your crystal lens works through any material you can see through with this @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.MWguJ6RWEmmPBntb]{X-Ray Vision} spell, even if you wouldn't normally have line of effect.

Crystal Lens (Superior).name: Crystal Lens (Superior)
Crystal Lens (Superior).description:
A psychically active crystal replaces the lens of one of your eyes. You gain 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} as a constant ability. Your ability to sense psychic energies grants you a +2 item bonus to Perception checks.

Activate—Psychic X-Rays 2 (concentrate)

Frequency twice per day

Effect You gain the effects of an x-ray vision spell. The detect magic of your crystal lens works through any material you can see through with this @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.MWguJ6RWEmmPBntb]{X-Ray Vision} spell, even if you wouldn't normally have line of effect.

Crystal Lens (Tactical).name: Crystal Lens (Tactical)
Crystal Lens (Tactical).description: A psychically active crystal replaces the lens of one of your eyes. You gain 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} as a constant ability. Your ability to sense psychic energies grants you a +2 item bonus to Perception checks.

Crystal Lens (Ultimate).name: Crystal Lens (Ultimate)
Crystal Lens (Ultimate).description:
A psychically active crystal replaces the lens of one of your eyes. You gain 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} as a constant ability. You see the location of all auras within 30 feet, not just the strongest. Your ability to sense psychic energies grants you a +3 item bonus to Perception checks.

If you use a Seek action to study a creature you can see, you can perceive an aura that conveys knowledge of that creature’s health, including all conditions and afflictions it has and an approximate percentage of its remaining Hit Points.

Activate—Psychic X-Rays 2 (concentrate)

Frequency three times per day

Effect You gain the effects of an x-ray vision spell. The detect magic of your crystal lens works through any material you can see through with this @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.MWguJ6RWEmmPBntb]{X-Ray Vision} spell, even if you wouldn't normally have line of effect.

Darkvision Capacitors (Commercial).name: Darkvision Capacitors (Commercial)
Darkvision Capacitors (Commercial).description: These replacement cybernetic eyes grant you darkvision. Darkvision capacitors operate by emitting low-powered ultraviolet lasers that receptors in the capacitors can detect. Creatures that have tactical darkvision capacitors (or can otherwise see ultraviolet light) can detect these lasers.

Darkvision Capacitors (Tactical).name: Darkvision Capacitors (Tactical)
Darkvision Capacitors (Tactical).description:
These replacement cybernetic eyes grant you darkvision. Darkvision capacitors operate by emitting low-powered ultraviolet lasers that receptors in the capacitors can detect. Creatures that have tactical darkvision capacitors (or can otherwise see ultraviolet light) can detect these lasers.

These upgraded capacitors include a wide-spectrum ocular implant that allows you to see infrared and ultraviolet light. You gain darkvision and a +2 item bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} if they involve sight. You're able to notice some things people who can see only the red-violet light spectrum can, including the lasers from other darkvision capacitors.

Darkvision Visor.name: Darkvision Visor
Darkvision Visor.description: This visor wraps around your visual organs, enhancing your natural senses. You gain darkvision.

Data Chip.name: Data Chip
Data Chip.description: A data chip contains enough memory for a religious text, photo album, personal journal, or the like. You can view the information on a data chip with a computer, such as the one in your comm unit.

Datajack (Advanced).name: Datajack (Advanced)
Datajack (Advanced).description:
This cybernetic is a programmable data port that integrates into your body, allowing you to access computers and digital storage devices. Any handheld computer can be inserted directly into the port, while larger systems typically require an adapter cable. You don't need an interface to access the system, as it connects directly to your nervous system via the datajack. You must still attempt any skill checks associated with operating the device, such as Computers to access a system. Some closed systems don't allow direct data access at all.

You gain a +2 item bonus to Computers checks when accessing a system with an advanced datajack.

Datajack (Commercial).name: Datajack (Commercial)
Datajack (Commercial).description: This cybernetic is a programmable data port that integrates into your body, allowing you to access computers and digital storage devices. Any handheld computer can be inserted directly into the port, while larger systems typically require an adapter cable. You don't need an interface to access the system, as it connects directly to your nervous system via the datajack. You must still attempt any skill checks associated with operating the device, such as Computers to access a system. Some closed systems don't allow direct data access at all.

Datajack (Tactical).name: Datajack (Tactical)
Datajack (Tactical).description:
This cybernetic is a programmable data port that integrates into your body, allowing you to access computers and digital storage devices. Any handheld computer can be inserted directly into the port, while larger systems typically require an adapter cable. You don't need an interface to access the system, as it connects directly to your nervous system via the datajack. You must still attempt any skill checks associated with operating the device, such as Computers to access a system. Some closed systems don't allow direct data access at all.

You gain a +1 item bonus to Computers checks when accessing a system with a tactical datajack.

Datapad.name: Datapad
Datapad.description: These ubiquitous handheld computers incorporate a comm unit, microphone, speaker, camera, infosphere browser, and data storage. They can store thousands of hours of recordings, play games, and perform simple computing functions, such as time tracking and notifications, word processing, calculations, data processing, streaming media, and broadcasting emergency alerts from local governments. In most societies, commercial datapads are relatively flimsy, designed to rapidly wear out or fall behind on the latest features and updates to encourage the consumer to replace it with a newer model. In contrast, higher-end datapads are made to last and often include a sturdier chassis and extra functions.

Defiance Series.name: Defiance Series
Defiance Series.description:
Upgrades: 1

This squad armor is a molded shell of reinforced polycarbon attached to a helmet with a tinted, retractable visor.

Deflecting Field.name: Deflecting Field
Deflecting Field.description: This shield isn't held—instead, it's installed as an armor or weapon upgrade. A deflecting field appears as a translucent panel integrated into the upgraded item and creates a temporary protective hardlight barrier when activated.

Defrex Hide.name: Defrex Hide
Defrex Hide.description:
Upgrades: 1

Made from the hide of a ferocious mammal native to Vesk-2, this light armor is especially popular among vesk. Tanned slabs of the creature's thick hide are stitched together with metal wires, and the joints are reinforced with metal studs or scales.

Dermal Plating (Advanced).name: Dermal Plating (Advanced)
Dermal Plating (Advanced).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 3 to physical damage.

Dermal Plating (Commercial).name: Dermal Plating (Commercial)
Dermal Plating (Commercial).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 1 to physical damage.

Dermal Plating (Elite).name: Dermal Plating (Elite)
Dermal Plating (Elite).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 7 to physical damage.

Dermal Plating (Paragon).name: Dermal Plating (Paragon)
Dermal Plating (Paragon).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 9 to physical damage.

Dermal Plating (Superior).name: Dermal Plating (Superior)
Dermal Plating (Superior).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 6 to physical damage.

Dermal Plating (Tactical).name: Dermal Plating (Tactical)
Dermal Plating (Tactical).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 2 to physical damage.

Dermal Plating (Ultimate).name: Dermal Plating (Ultimate)
Dermal Plating (Ultimate).description: Hardened composites line your skin and help you deflect physical blows. You gain resistance 8 to physical damage.

Disintegration Lash.name: Disintegration Lash
Disintegration Lash.description:
Upgrades: 1

Appearing as an undulating black snake when powered, this whip crackles with red-tinged energy that sunders whatever it strikes at the atomic level.

Diva's Microphone (Advanced).name: Diva's Microphone (Advanced)
Diva's Microphone (Advanced).description:
This ostentatious crystal microphone is embellished with glimmering jewels and delicate lights that pulse in time to music. It functions as both a microphone and speaker, amplifying your voice loud enough for you to be heard clearly by all listeners up to 500 feet away, even if other ambient noise would otherwise block the sound. This doesn't increase the range or area of other auditory or linguistic effects, and physical barriers such as walls still block or muffle your voice as normal. It grants a +3 item bonus to Performance checks made with it.

Activate—Grand Finale 2 (auditory)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Your song reaches an eardrum-bursting climax as a 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.gap2XOeiCcC2yeDe] originating from your space with a of DC 38.

Diva's Microphone (Commercial).name: Diva's Microphone (Commercial)
Diva's Microphone (Commercial).description:
This ostentatious crystal microphone is embellished with glimmering jewels and delicate lights that pulse in time to music. It functions as both a microphone and speaker, amplifying your voice loud enough for you to be heard clearly by all listeners up to 500 feet away, even if other ambient noise would otherwise block the sound. This doesn't increase the range or area of other auditory or linguistic effects, and physical barriers such as walls still block or muffle your voice as normal. It grants a +1 item bonus to Performance checks made with it.

Activate—Grand Finale 2 (auditory)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Your song reaches an eardrum-bursting climax as a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.gap2XOeiCcC2yeDe] originating from your space with a of DC 18.

Diva's Microphone (Tactical).name: Diva's Microphone (Tactical)
Diva's Microphone (Tactical).description:
This ostentatious crystal microphone is embellished with glimmering jewels and delicate lights that pulse in time to music. It functions as both a microphone and speaker, amplifying your voice loud enough for you to be heard clearly by all listeners up to 500 feet away, even if other ambient noise would otherwise block the sound. This doesn't increase the range or area of other auditory or linguistic effects, and physical barriers such as walls still block or muffle your voice as normal. It grants a +2 item bonus to Performance checks made with it.

Activate—Grand Finale 2 (auditory)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Your song reaches an eardrum-bursting climax as a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.gap2XOeiCcC2yeDe] originating from your space with a of DC 27.

Doshko.name: Doshko
Doshko.description:
Upgrades: 1

The traditional weapon of the Veskarium, this powered poleaxe features one to three triangular blades forged for both wide overhead swings and tactical parrying.

Dragon Gland (Advanced).name: Dragon Gland (Advanced)
Dragon Gland (Advanced).description:
You implant an arcanicus gland modified to function for a creature of your ancestry at the back of your throat. When the organ is biocrafted, choose your augmentation's damage type from the following list: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain the following activation.

Activate—Exhale 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] takes @Damage[6d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.damage]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC.

Dragon Gland (Commercial).name: Dragon Gland (Commercial)
Dragon Gland (Commercial).description:
You implant an arcanicus gland modified to function for a creature of your ancestry at the back of your throat. When the organ is biocrafted, choose your augmentation's damage type from the following list: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain the following activation.

Activate—Exhale 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] takes @Damage[2d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.damage]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC.

Dragon Gland (Elite).name: Dragon Gland (Elite)
Dragon Gland (Elite).description:
You implant an arcanicus gland modified to function for a creature of your ancestry at the back of your throat. When the organ is biocrafted, choose your augmentation's damage type from the following list: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain the following activation.

Activate—Exhale 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] takes @Damage[14d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.damage]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC.

Dragon Gland (Superior).name: Dragon Gland (Superior)
Dragon Gland (Superior).description:

Activate—Exhale 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] takes @Damage[10d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.damage]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC.

Dragon Gland (Tactical).name: Dragon Gland (Tactical)
Dragon Gland (Tactical).description:
You implant an arcanicus gland modified to function for a creature of your ancestry at the back of your throat. When the organ is biocrafted, choose your augmentation's damage type from the following list: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain the following activation.

Activate—Exhale 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect Each creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] takes @Damage[4d6[@item.flags.pf2e.rulesSelections.damage]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)|basic:true] save against your class DC.

Dueling Sword.name: Dueling Sword
Dueling Sword.description:
Upgrades: 1

Coming in a variety of styles, these traditional and time-tested weapons have been honed with advanced smithing techniques, often employing nanocarbon steel to ensure they never dull or lose their luster.

Emergency beacon.name: Emergency beacon
Emergency beacon.description: This item requires a battery to be installed on it for it to operate. When activated, this small, pod-shaped device transmits its location and emits a flash of bright red light once per round, consuming 1 charge per day. Any device capable of receiving signals can pick up a signal from an emergency beacon, which can then be traced with a successful @Check[type:computers|dc:15] or @Check[type:survival|dc:15] check. An emergency beacon's transmissions have a range of 100 miles over flat terrain, 50 miles in forests or hills, and 25 miles in mountainous terrain or underwater. Alternatively, an emergency beacon can be installed in a starship or vehicle's communications system. In this case, its range is equal to that of the communications array, and it consumes 1 charge per hour.

Energy Shielding (Advanced).name: Energy Shielding (Advanced)
Energy Shielding (Advanced).description: This armor is specially treated with insulation to protect against a specific type of damage. You gain resistance 15 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the upgrade. Multiple energy shielding upgrades can be placed into a suit of armor, but each must provide resistance to a different damage type.

Energy Shielding (Commercial).name: Energy Shielding (Commercial)
Energy Shielding (Commercial).description: This armor is specially treated with insulation to protect against a specific type of damage. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the upgrade. Multiple energy shielding upgrades can be placed into a suit of armor, but each must provide resistance to a different damage type.

Energy Shielding (Tactical).name: Energy Shielding (Tactical)
Energy Shielding (Tactical).description: This armor is specially treated with insulation to protect against a specific type of damage. You gain resistance 10 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the upgrade. Multiple energy shielding upgrades can be placed into a suit of armor, but each must provide resistance to a different damage type.

Entropic Destabilizer (Commercial).name: Entropic Destabilizer (Commercial)
Entropic Destabilizer (Commercial).description: Tendrils of dark energy soar from the unit affixed to this weapon, coating it and its ammunition in a disturbing purple hue. When you hit with the weapon, add @Damage[1d4[void]] damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target takes @Damage[2d4[persistent,void]] damage; if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from an entropic destabilizer damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.

Entropic Destabilizer (Tactical).name: Entropic Destabilizer (Tactical)
Entropic Destabilizer (Tactical).description: Tendrils of dark energy soar from the unit affixed to this weapon, coating it and its ammunition in a disturbing purple hue. When you hit with the weapon, add @Damage[1d4[void]] damage to the damage dealt. The void damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s void resistance or immunity. In addition, on a critical hit, the target takes @Damage[4d4[persistent,void]] damage; if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from an entropic destabilizer damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.

Estex Suit.name: Estex Suit
Estex Suit.description:
Upgrades: 1

This bulky flight suit is reinforced with thin polycarbon panels sewn between layers of tactical fabric.

Explorer's Canteen.name: Explorer's Canteen
Explorer's Canteen.description: This metal thermos has two compartments. The upper compartment contains nanomachines and filters that target common contaminants, making most food and water safe to consume and granting a +1 item bonus to saves against any poisons or diseases present in the food or water. The lower compartment converts inserted UPBs into edible nutri-paste at a rate of 2 UPBs per 1 day of nourishment.

Explosive Defense Unit.name: Explosive Defense Unit
Explosive Defense Unit.description:
These reinforced custom armor plates automatically generate containment fields to protect you from nearby explosions, granting you resistance 2 to area damage (acid, cold, electricity, and fire damage only). You can also store a grenade in the explosive defense unit and detonate it without harming yourself.

Activate—Store Grenade 2 (manipulate)

Effect You place a grenade inside a reinforced compartment in the explosive defense unit. You can Interact to retrieve the grenade normally. You can store only one grenade in the armor upgrade at a time.

Activate—Defensive Detonation 1 (manipulate)

Requirements You have a stored grenade

Effect You detonate the grenade stored in the explosive defense unit. The explosion is centered on your space, but the upgrade generates a containment field to protect you from its effects. The grenade otherwise functions as if you had activated it normally.

Fangblade.name: Fangblade
Fangblade.description:
Upgrades: 1

Sharp, durable teeth line the edges of this motorized sword and spin with the force of an industrial chainsaw. Practiced wielders can leverage the kickback from one swing to skillfully set up the next.

Fear Projector (Commercial).name: Fear Projector (Commercial)
Fear Projector (Commercial).description: This integrated hologram projector makes the wounds caused by the weapon look way worse than they are. When you critically hit with this weapon, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Fear Projector (Tactical).name: Fear Projector (Tactical)
Fear Projector (Tactical).description: This integrated hologram projector makes the wounds caused by the weapon look way worse than they are. When you critically hit with this weapon, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Feline Senses Spell Amp.name: Feline Senses Spell Amp
Feline Senses Spell Amp.description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.xL5pDBaf7NR8wN8N] spell

Field Scientist's Toolkit (Commercial).name: Field Scientist's Toolkit (Commercial)
Field Scientist's Toolkit (Commercial).description: A field scientist toolkit contains a chemalyzer, microscope, recording tools, and specimen bags. A tactical field scientist toolkit grants a +1 item bonus on Recall Knowledge checks using Nature or an appropriate Lore skill.

Field Scientist's Toolkit (Tactical).name: Field Scientist's Toolkit (Tactical)
Field Scientist's Toolkit (Tactical).description: A field scientist toolkit contains a chemalyzer, microscope, recording tools, and specimen bags. A tactical field scientist toolkit grants a +1 item bonus on Recall Knowledge checks using Nature or an appropriate Lore skill.

Filtered Rebreather (Advanced).name: Filtered Rebreather (Advanced)
Filtered Rebreather (Advanced).description: This armor upgrade supplements your armor's ability to provide fresh air and filters out common contaminants. Armor with this upgrade can provide fresh air for a number of days equal to its level. You also gain a +3 status bonus to Fortitude saves against inhaled effects.

Filtered Rebreather (Commercial).name: Filtered Rebreather (Commercial)
Filtered Rebreather (Commercial).description: This armor upgrade supplements your armor's ability to provide fresh air and filters out common contaminants. Armor with this upgrade can provide fresh air for a number of days equal to its level. You also gain a +1 status bonus to Fortitude saves against inhaled effects.

Filtered Rebreather (Superior).name: Filtered Rebreather (Superior)
Filtered Rebreather (Superior).description: This armor upgrade supplements your armor's ability to provide fresh air and filters out common contaminants. Armor with this upgrade can provide fresh air for a number of days equal to its level. You also gain a +4 status bonus to Fortitude saves against inhaled effects.

Filtered Rebreather (Tactical).name: Filtered Rebreather (Tactical)
Filtered Rebreather (Tactical).description: This armor upgrade supplements your armor's ability to provide fresh air and filters out common contaminants. Armor with this upgrade can provide fresh air for a number of days equal to its level. You also gain a +2 status bonus to Fortitude saves against inhaled effects.

Fireburst Chamber.name: Fireburst Chamber
Fireburst Chamber.description:
A fireburst chamber allows you to direct the detonation of a grenade inside of a grenade launcher or an undermounted grenade launcher.

Activate—Fireburst Mode 1 (manipulate)

Effect The grenade launcher or the undermounted grenade launcher gains the area (cone) trait with a range of 15 feet and uses the properties of the grenade it fires instead of using its normal range. You can end this effect with an Interact action.

Fixed Point Solarian Crystal.name: Fixed Point Solarian Crystal
Fixed Point Solarian Crystal.description:
A fixed point crystal gives you greater control over the cycle of energies in your solar mote.

Activate—Halt Cycle 1 (concentrate)

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger You critically hit with your solar weapon or solar shot as part of an action with the cycle trait

Effect You can choose whether to change your attunement state or remain in your current attunement state.

Flamethrower.name: Flamethrower
Flamethrower.description:
Upgrades: 1

This bulky, rifle-shaped weapon spews flames using a tank of highly combustible, pressurized chemicals housed in its stock.

Flaming Module (Commercial).name: Flaming Module (Commercial)
Flaming Module (Commercial).description: This module overheats the weapon's striking edge and ammunition. The weapon deals an additional @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage on a successful Strike, plus @Damage[1d10[persistent,fire]] damage on a critical hit.

Flaming Module (Tactical).name: Flaming Module (Tactical)
Flaming Module (Tactical).description:
This module overheats the weapon's striking edge and ammunition. The weapon deals an additional @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage on a successful Strike, plus @Damage[2d10[persistent,fire]] damage on a critical hit.

Fire damage dealt by this weapon (including the persistent fire damage) ignores the target’s fire resistance.

Flash Grenade (Advanced).name: Flash Grenade (Advanced)
Flash Grenade (Advanced).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

A flash grenade unleashes a blast of bright light that requires creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] to make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save. On a failure the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 2 rounds.

Critical @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Flash Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

A flash grenade unleashes a blast of bright light that requires creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] to make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save. Flash Grenade (Elite).description:

Flash Grenade (Ultimate).description:
