Infiltrator Serum.name: Infiltrator Serum
Infiltrator Serum.description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This clear, oily serum grants a +1 item bonus to checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} and Disable a Device for 10 minutes.

Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commercial).name: Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commercial)
Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commercial).description: You need an infiltrator's toolkit to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. A tactical infiltrator's toolkit adds a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks or Disable Devices.

Infiltrator's Toolkit (Tactical).name: Infiltrator's Toolkit (Tactical)
Infiltrator's Toolkit (Tactical).description: You need an infiltrator's toolkit to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. A tactical infiltrator's toolkit adds a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks or Disable Devices.

Injection Rifle.name: Injection Rifle
Injection Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

The injection rifle includes a cannister of poison that fills any empty darts loaded in the chamber. This rifle’s precursors were designed to tranquilize dangerous animals for conservation purposes, and some modern wielders use sedative or corrosive darts instead.

Invisibility Spell Amp.name: Invisibility Spell Amp
Invisibility Spell Amp.description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB] spell

Irising Shield.name: Irising Shield
Irising Shield.description: An irising shield is made of flexible polycarbon with a retractable design. When retracted, an irising shield looks like a decorative bangle, gauntlet, or glove. When deployed, its panels flare out and form a miniature circular shield.

Jetpack (Commercial).name: Jetpack (Commercial)
Jetpack (Commercial).description:
Boosters the size of a backpack attach to the back of your armor and allow you to fly.

Activate—Fly 1 (manipulate)

Effect You activate a jetpack to gain a fly Speed of 20 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you Dismiss it. You can use an action to Fly 0 feet to hover in place, but you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while doing so. A jetpack can't lift you if you're encumbered.

Jetpack (Tactical).name: Jetpack (Tactical)
Jetpack (Tactical).description:
Boosters the size of a backpack attach to the back of your armor and allow you to fly.

Activate—Fly 1 (manipulate)

Effect You activate a jetpack to gain a fly Speed of 40 feet. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you Dismiss it. You can use an action to Fly 0 feet to hover in place. A jetpack can't lift you if you're encumbered.

Jump Jets.name: Jump Jets
Jump Jets.description:
Powerful boosters attached to your armor allow you to fly short distances.

Activate—Jump 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per round

Effect You activate the jump jets to get a quick boost. You Fly up to 20 feet with a maximum height of 10 feet, or you Fly up to 20 feet straight up. You must land at the end of this movement or fall. Jump jets can't lift you if you're encumbered.

Jump Spell Amp.name: Jump Spell Amp
Jump Spell Amp.description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36] spell

Knife.name: Knife
Knife.description:
Upgrades: 1

Invaluable as both a weapon and a tool, knives come in a variety of shapes, styles, and materials ranging from carbon steel to ceramics. Archaic knives made with outdated materials that predate modern crafting methods are sometimes treated against corrosion to preserve these traditional armaments.

Kyokor Plating.name: Kyokor Plating
Kyokor Plating.description:
Upgrade: 1

This heavy armor incorporates a full-coverage polycarbon suit studded with ports and sockets and layered with plates from Daimalko's infamous colossi. Kyokor plating comes with boots, gloves, and a helmet with a clear visor.

Laser Pistol.name: Laser Pistol
Laser Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This compact energy pistol is the most popular sidearm in the Pact Worlds thanks to its reliability, durability, and affordability. Most common laser pistols have a heat-treated lightweight polycarbon body ending in a long, slim barrel.

Laser Rifle.name: Laser Rifle
Laser Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

These dependable mass-produced rifles shoot concentrated beams of energy out of square-shaped barrels. The universal standard Pact Worlds model is highly modifiable and designed to function with a variety of accessories and upgrades, with wielders adapting the laser rifle to their preferences and even kit-bashing it into a nearly unrecognizable weapon.

Load Lifter (Advanced).name: Load Lifter (Advanced)
Load Lifter (Advanced).description: This series of support braces automatically shifts when you move, allowing you to carry and lift beyond your normal capacity. You can carry an amount of Bulk equal to 8 plus your Strength modifier without becoming encumbered, and you can hold and carry a total Bulk up to 13 plus your Strength modifier.

Load Lifter (Commercial).name: Load Lifter (Commercial)
Load Lifter (Commercial).description: This series of support braces automatically shifts when you move, allowing you to carry and lift beyond your normal capacity. You can carry an amount of Bulk equal to 6 plus your Strength modifier without becoming encumbered, and you can hold and carry a total Bulk up to 11 plus your Strength modifier.

Load Lifter (Tactical).name: Load Lifter (Tactical)
Load Lifter (Tactical).description: This series of support braces automatically shifts when you move, allowing you to carry and lift beyond your normal capacity. You can carry an amount of Bulk equal to 7 plus your Strength modifier without becoming encumbered, and you can hold and carry a total Bulk up to 12 plus your Strength modifier.

Lock (Advanced).name: Lock (Advanced)
Lock (Advanced).description: Picking a commercial lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:15] checks, a tactical lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] checks, an advanced lock requires four successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:25]{DC 25}, a superior lock requires five successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:30]{DC 30}, and an elite lock requires six successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:40]{DC 40}.

Lock (Commercial).name: Lock (Commercial)
Lock (Commercial).description: Picking a commercial lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:15] checks, a tactical lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] checks, an advanced lock requires four successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:25]{DC 25}, a superior lock requires five successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:30]{DC 30}, and an elite lock requires six successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:40]{DC 40}.

Lock (Elite).name: Lock (Elite)
Lock (Elite).description: Picking a commercial lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:15] checks, a tactical lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] checks, an advanced lock requires four successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:25]{DC 25}, a superior lock requires five successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:30]{DC 30}, and an elite lock requires six successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:40]{DC 40}.

Lock (Superior).name: Lock (Superior)
Lock (Superior).description: Picking a commercial lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:15] checks, a tactical lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] checks, an advanced lock requires four successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:25]{DC 25}, a superior lock requires five successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:30]{DC 30}, and an elite lock requires six successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:40]{DC 40}.

Lock (Tactical).name: Lock (Tactical)
Lock (Tactical).description: Picking a commercial lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:15] checks, a tactical lock requires two successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] checks, an advanced lock requires four successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:25]{DC 25}, a superior lock requires five successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:30]{DC 30}, and an elite lock requires six successes at @Check[type:thievery|dc:40]{DC 40}.

Loudener (Commercial).name: Loudener (Commercial)
Loudener (Commercial).description: This specialized cone is installed over the muzzle or hilt of a weapon to use pneumonic pulses and passive acoustics to increase the volume of its attacks, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

Loudener (Tactical).name: Loudener (Tactical)
Loudener (Tactical).description:
This specialized cone is installed over the muzzle or hilt of a weapon to use pneumonic pulses and passive acoustics to increase the volume of its attacks, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

Sonic damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s sonic resistance.

Machine Gun.name: Machine Gun
Machine Gun.description:
Upgrades: 1

These proven and reliable automatic weapons are capable of firing in short bursts or completely emptying their magazines to clear a battlefield.

Magboots.name: Magboots
Magboots.description: These sturdy boots have powerful electromagnets built into the soles. These magnets can be activated or deactivated with an Interact action. While active, they grant you a +1 item bonus to Athletics checks to Climb metal surfaces, as well as a +1 item bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} you when you are standing on a metal surface. In areas of zero gravity, while wearing a pair of magboots, you can move your Speed across metal surfaces and don't gain the @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} condition.

Magnetar Rifle.name: Magnetar Rifle
Magnetar Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This rifle uses powerful electromagnets to accelerate simple slugs into deadly, highly accurate projectiles without the use of any moving parts.

Maker's App.name: Maker's App
Maker's App.description: This comm unit app contains formulas for Crafting common items.

Maker's Toolkit (Commercial).name: Maker's Toolkit (Commercial)
Maker's Toolkit (Commercial).description: You need a maker's toolkit to create items from UPBs with the Craft skill. A tactical maker's toolkit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check.

Maker's Toolkit (Tactical).name: Maker's Toolkit (Tactical)
Maker's Toolkit (Tactical).description: You need a maker's toolkit to create items from UPBs with the Craft skill. A tactical maker's toolkit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check.

Maneuvering Unit (Advanced).name: Maneuvering Unit (Advanced)
Maneuvering Unit (Advanced).description:
Using internal stabilizers and jets that thrust using compressed gas, armor installed with a maneuvering unit allows you to control the direction you move in zero gravity environments. You are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Thrust 1 (move)

Requirements You are in a zero-g environment

Effect You move 15 feet in any direction you choose. You begin to float in that direction.

Maneuvering Unit (Commercial).name: Maneuvering Unit (Commercial)
Maneuvering Unit (Commercial).description:
Using internal stabilizers and jets that thrust using compressed gas, armor installed with a maneuvering unit allows you to control the direction you move in zero gravity environments. You are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Thrust 1 (move)

Requirements You are in a zero-g environment

Effect You move 5 feet in any direction you choose. You begin to float in that direction.

Maneuvering Unit (Superior).name: Maneuvering Unit (Superior)
Maneuvering Unit (Superior).description:
Using internal stabilizers and jets that thrust using compressed gas, armor installed with a maneuvering unit allows you to control the direction you move in zero gravity environments. You are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Thrust 1 (move)

Requirements You are in a zero-g environment

Effect You move 30 feet in any direction you choose. You begin to float in that direction.

Maneuvering Unit (Tactical).name: Maneuvering Unit (Tactical)
Maneuvering Unit (Tactical).description:
Using internal stabilizers and jets that thrust using compressed gas, armor installed with a maneuvering unit allows you to control the direction you move in zero gravity environments. You are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or clumsy while @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} in zero-g.

Activate—Thrust 1 (move)

Requirements You are in a zero-g environment

Effect You move 10 feet in any direction you choose. You begin to float in that direction.

Medkit (Commercial).name: Medkit (Commercial)
Medkit (Commercial).description: Medkits contain analgesics, bandages, sterile gauze, and suturing tools necessary for Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. Tactical medkits provide a +1 item bonus to such checks.

Medkit (Tactical).name: Medkit (Tactical)
Medkit (Tactical).description: Medkits contain analgesics, bandages, sterile gauze, and suturing tools necessary for Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. Tactical medkits provide a +1 item bonus to such checks.

Medpatch (Advanced).name: Medpatch (Advanced)
Medpatch (Advanced).description:
Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system.

Activate—Apply 1 (manipulate)

You regain @Damage[(5d6+12)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.5zI4ZyazPuowjhwJ]{Effect: Medpatch}

Medpatch (Commercial).name: Medpatch (Commercial)
Medpatch (Commercial).description:
Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system.

Activate—Apply 1 (manipulate)

You regain @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.5zI4ZyazPuowjhwJ]{Effect: Medpatch}

Medpatch (Elite).name: Medpatch (Elite)
Medpatch (Elite).description:
Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system.

Activate—Apply 1 (manipulate)

You regain @Damage[(8d6+21)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.5zI4ZyazPuowjhwJ]{Effect: Medpatch}

Medpatch (Superior).name: Medpatch (Superior)
Medpatch (Superior).description:
Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system.

Activate—Apply 1 (manipulate)

You regain @Damage[(7d6+18)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.5zI4ZyazPuowjhwJ]{Effect: Medpatch}

Medpatch (Tactical).name: Medpatch (Tactical)
Medpatch (Tactical).description:
Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system.

Activate—Apply 1 (manipulate)

You regain @Damage[(3d6+6)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.5zI4ZyazPuowjhwJ]{Effect: Medpatch}

Medpatch (Ultimate).name: Medpatch (Ultimate)
Medpatch (Ultimate).description:
Medpatches accelerate the body's natural healing processes and immune system.

Activate—Apply 1 (manipulate)

You regain @Damage[(10d6+27)[healing]] Hit Points and gain a +4 item bonus to saving throws against disease and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.conditions.Item.5zI4ZyazPuowjhwJ]{Effect: Medpatch}

Merciful.name: Merciful
Merciful.description:
Merciful weapons are sheathed in an unmistakable wispy green aura recognized by both soldiers and law enforcement around the universe. A merciful weapon has the nonlethal trait and can't be used to make a lethal attack. Any persistent damage the weapon would deal is negated.

On a critical hit, a merciful weapon causes the target to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the weapon's wielder for 1 minute, as the target is bombarded with feelings of guilt and remorse. This is a mental effect. If you have access to the weapon's critical specialization effect, you choose whether to use it or the merciful effect.

Microcord Armor.name: Microcord Armor
Microcord Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

This light armor is woven from ultralight fibers that flex with a wearer's movements but turn hard as steel on impact.

Microgoggles.name: Microgoggles
Microgoggles.description: These bulky goggles include adjustable magnifying lenses and lights, granting you a +2 item bonus to any skill check that benefits from exceedingly close vision, such as detecting complicated forgeries, identifying pathogens in blood samples, or crafting drugs or medicinals.

Microphone.name: Microphone
Microphone.description: This cordless handheld device records and transmits audio, typically to a speaker or computer you've synced with the microphone.

Missile Launcher.name: Missile Launcher
Missile Launcher.description:
Activate 2 Area Fire

Often mounted on a ship, tripod, or the broad shoulders of a well-armored soldier, this square-shaped launcher can hold 4 missiles and is designed to minimize recoil while keeping its wielder safe from potentially scalding backblast. A missile launcher is a martial ranged weapon, has a reload of 2, and a range of 60 feet.

Mobile Bulwark.name: Mobile Bulwark
Mobile Bulwark.description: This bulky shield is advertised as the ultimate protection in battle for those strong enough to hoist them. Mobile bulwarks create an iconic rectangular silhouette and are popular with heavily armored mercenaries and soldiers, notably among the Veskarium military and some orders of Hellknights. A mobile bulwark is often constructed of carbon steel, with a transparent aluminum view port.

Mobility Enhancer (Commercial).name: Mobility Enhancer (Commercial)
Mobility Enhancer (Commercial).description: This system of elastic braces and joint support structures reduces the stress armor exerts on your body, allowing you to move faster despite the armor's bulk. Reduce your armor's penalty to Speeds by 5 feet.

Mobility Enhancer (Tactical).name: Mobility Enhancer (Tactical)
Mobility Enhancer (Tactical).description: This system of elastic braces and joint support structures reduces the stress armor exerts on your body, allowing you to move faster despite the armor's bulk. Reduce your armor's penalty to Speeds by 10 feet.

Moodskin.name: Moodskin
Moodskin.description:
Your skin cells contain a dye manufactured from magically infused crystals that automatically reacts to your mood by changing the pigmentation of your skin. The color change is gradual, typically taking at least thirty seconds to fully transition from one color to another. Moodskin can be customized to adjust which colors correspond to each mood during installation. The default meaning of each color is as follows.

  • Red: angry, passionate, intensely emotional
  • Orange: irritated, surprised, unsettled
  • Yellow: nervous, tense, cautious
  • Green: ambivalent
  • Blue: calm, content, collected
  • Dark Blue: peaceful, happy, optimistic
  • Purple: tranquil
  • Black: sad, stressed, deflated, tired

Moodskin does not count against your implant limit.

Morphic Skin (Advanced).name: Morphic Skin (Advanced)
Morphic Skin (Advanced).description:
Magical glands embedded in your skin release mutagenic enzymes and transformative energies. You can activate the glands to change your physical appearance.

Activate—Change Shape 3 (concentrate, magical)

Frequency once per day

Effect Your skin ripples as you change your outward appearance to match a desired set of features. You gain a status bonus to Deception checks to Impersonate another creature depending on your morphic skin's version.

You change your appearance—including apparent age, sex, height, weight, skin tone, visible musculature, hair color, scales, or similar minor features.

You can change your appearance to gain features of another ancestry, including extra appendages, fur, scales, or similar minor and major features (although you don’t gain or lose abilities as a result).

You can change your appearance to match a specific individual, including fingerprints, retinal patterns, and other features used to bypass biometric security keyed to that individual. The status bonus is +3.

Morphic Skin (Commercial).name: Morphic Skin (Commercial)
Morphic Skin (Commercial).description:
Magical glands embedded in your skin release mutagenic enzymes and transformative energies. You can activate the glands to change your physical appearance.

Activate—Change Shape 3 (concentrate, magical)

Frequency once per day

Effect Your skin ripples as you change your outward appearance to match a desired set of features. You gain a status bonus to Deception checks to Impersonate another creature depending on your morphic skin's version.

You change your appearance—including apparent age, sex, height, weight, skin tone, visible musculature, hair color, scales, or similar minor features—within the normal bounds of your ancestry. The status bonus is +1.

Morphic Skin (Tactical).name: Morphic Skin (Tactical)
Morphic Skin (Tactical).description:
Magical glands embedded in your skin release mutagenic enzymes and transformative energies. You can activate the glands to change your physical appearance.

Activate—Change Shape 3 (concentrate, magical)

Frequency once per day

Effect Your skin ripples as you change your outward appearance to match a desired set of features. You gain a status bonus to Deception checks to Impersonate another creature depending on your morphic skin's version.

You change your appearance—including apparent age, sex, height, weight, skin tone, visible musculature, hair color, scales, or similar minor features.

You can change your appearance to gain features of another ancestry, including extra appendages, fur, scales, or similar minor and major features (although you don’t gain or lose abilities as a result). The status bonus is +2.

Muscle Invigorator.name: Muscle Invigorator
Muscle Invigorator.description:
This augmentation keeps your muscles in peak condition. You gain a +3 item bonus to Athletics checks and a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to lift a heavy object, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open}. When you get this augmentation, you either increase your Strength modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value.

Activate—Strength of the Colossi 1 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You temporarily become as destructive and powerful as a colossus. For 1 hour, your Strikes with unarmed or brawling weapons ignore the hardness of all objects and structures not made of adamantine or a harder material. Against objects and structures made of such materials, these Strikes ignore half the hardness. Additionally, for the duration, if you fail an Athletics check to lift a heavy object, Escape, or Force Open, you succeed instead. You can still critically fail.

Musical Instrument (Handheld, Commercial.name: Musical Instrument (Handheld, Commercial)
Musical Instrument (Handheld, Commercial.description:
Musical instruments are popular throughout the galaxy and come in a dizzying array of styles. All but the most traditional and classical instruments use modern technology to amplify their sound, provide musical accompaniment, or connect wirelessly to other instruments in a band or orchestra. Handheld instruments include autohorns, monofilament guitars, psychoactive wave plates, synth keytars, holoflutes, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a bass synthorn) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as drumdecks, keyboard instruments, and theremins are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

A tactical instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

Musical Instrument (Handheld, Tactical).name: Musical Instrument (Handheld, Tactical)
Musical Instrument (Handheld, Tactical).description:
Musical instruments are popular throughout the galaxy and come in a dizzying array of styles. All but the most traditional and classical instruments use modern technology to amplify their sound, provide musical accompaniment, or connect wirelessly to other instruments in a band or orchestra. Handheld instruments include autohorns, monofilament guitars, psychoactive wave plates, synth keytars, holoflutes, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a bass synthorn) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as drumdecks, keyboard instruments, and theremins are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

A tactical instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

Musical Instrument (Heavy, Commercial).name: Musical Instrument (Heavy, Commercial)
Musical Instrument (Heavy, Commercial).description:
Musical instruments are popular throughout the galaxy and come in a dizzying array of styles. All but the most traditional and classical instruments use modern technology to amplify their sound, provide musical accompaniment, or connect wirelessly to other instruments in a band or orchestra. Handheld instruments include autohorns, monofilament guitars, psychoactive wave plates, synth keytars, holoflutes, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a bass synthorn) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as drumdecks, keyboard instruments, and theremins are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

A tactical instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

Musical Instrument (Heavy, Tactical).name: Musical Instrument (Heavy, Tactical)
Musical Instrument (Heavy, Tactical).description:
Musical instruments are popular throughout the galaxy and come in a dizzying array of styles. All but the most traditional and classical instruments use modern technology to amplify their sound, provide musical accompaniment, or connect wirelessly to other instruments in a band or orchestra. Handheld instruments include autohorns, monofilament guitars, psychoactive wave plates, synth keytars, holoflutes, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a bass synthorn) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as drumdecks, keyboard instruments, and theremins are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played.

A tactical instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

Nano-edge Rapier.name: Nano-edge Rapier
Nano-edge Rapier.description:
Upgrades: 1

The edge of this precision-crafted foil is sharpened to the thickness of a single atom, using regenerating nanites to maintain its edge after countless strikes

Nano-optics Node.name: Nano-optics Node
Nano-optics Node.description:
A crystalline nanocarbon node implanted in your occipital lobe is connected to your optic nerves by microscopic fibers. You can activate the node to overlay your normal vision with X-ray data. You can deactivate the overlay as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Activate—X-Ray Overlay 1 (concentrate)

Effect Your nano-optics node relays collected X-ray data directly to your eyes, overlaying your normal vision. You can see through most materials and walls within 60 feet. Your sight is blocked by 2 feet of wood or plastic, 1 foot of stone, 2 inches of common metal, or any amount of lead or any starmetal, and you can only see in black and white. Due to the distracting amount of visual information, you take a –2 penalty to Perception checks while the overlay is active.

Needler Pistol.name: Needler Pistol
Needler Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This snub-nosed pistol shoots syringes instead of bullets, allowing the wielder to deliver a dose of medicine or poison from a safe distance. Early needler pistols were red and white peashooters marked with a deity’s holy symbol. Antiques and replicas remain on the market, but are curiosities compared to subtler modern designs.

Neural Lash.name: Neural Lash
Neural Lash.description:
Upgrades: 1

This whiplike tendril of electricity subtly responds to psychic signals. Telepaths who wield a properly calibrated neural lash treat it as an extension of their body.

Null Space Chamber (Advanced).name: Null Space Chamber (Advanced)
Null Space Chamber (Advanced).description:
This sleek black device attaches to a backpack, purse, or key ring. When you press a button on the side of the device, it creates a circular portal to an extradimensional pocket space. The space can hold 100 bulk.

You can Interact with the null space chamber to stow items in it or remove them. The null space chamber can be opened and closed only from the outside. When a null space chamber is opened in an atmosphere with air, it fills with 10 minutes worth of air for every Bulk left in its capacity. An item inside the null space chamber provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. Affixing the null space chamber to a computer causes it to display a readout of all items stored within it.

Null Space Chamber (Commercial).name: Null Space Chamber (Commercial)
Null Space Chamber (Commercial).description:
This sleek black device attaches to a backpack, purse, or key ring. When you press a button on the side of the device, it creates a circular portal to an extradimensional pocket space. The space can hold 25 bulk.

You can Interact with the null space chamber to stow items in it or remove them. The null space chamber can be opened and closed only from the outside. When a null space chamber is opened in an atmosphere with air, it fills with 10 minutes worth of air for every Bulk left in its capacity. An item inside the null space chamber provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. Affixing the null space chamber to a computer causes it to display a readout of all items stored within it.

Null Space Chamber (Superior).name: Null Space Chamber (Superior)
Null Space Chamber (Superior).description:
This sleek black device attaches to a backpack, purse, or key ring. When you press a button on the side of the device, it creates a circular portal to an extradimensional pocket space. The space can hold 150 bulk.

You can Interact with the null space chamber to stow items in it or remove them. The null space chamber can be opened and closed only from the outside. When a null space chamber is opened in an atmosphere with air, it fills with 10 minutes worth of air for every Bulk left in its capacity. An item inside the null space chamber provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. Affixing the null space chamber to a computer causes it to display a readout of all items stored within it.

Null Space Chamber (Tactical).name: Null Space Chamber (Tactical)
Null Space Chamber (Tactical).description:
This sleek black device attaches to a backpack, purse, or key ring. When you press a button on the side of the device, it creates a circular portal to an extradimensional pocket space. The space can hold 50 bulk.

You can Interact with the null space chamber to stow items in it or remove them. The null space chamber can be opened and closed only from the outside. When a null space chamber is opened in an atmosphere with air, it fills with 10 minutes worth of air for every Bulk left in its capacity. An item inside the null space chamber provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. Affixing the null space chamber to a computer causes it to display a readout of all items stored within it.

Pain Journal (Commercial).name: Pain Journal (Commercial)
Pain Journal (Commercial).description:
Your raw emotions empower the poems and phrases penned in this faux leather journal. Reading directly from the journal harnesses your painful memories, projecting your anger, and gives you a +1 item bonus to Intimidation checks.

Activate—Painful Memory 2 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You recite a poem of utter anguish to spread your misery to another creature, as a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.7GPrc67AdaJFAFWm] with a DC of 23.

Pain Journal (Tactical).name: Pain Journal (Tactical)
Pain Journal (Tactical).description:
Your raw emotions empower the poems and phrases penned in this faux leather journal. Reading directly from the journal harnesses your painful memories, projecting your anger, and gives you a +2 item bonus to Intimidation checks.

Activate—Painful Memory 2 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You recite a poem of utter anguish to spread your misery to another creature, as a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.7GPrc67AdaJFAFWm] with a DC of 34.

Painglaive.name: Painglaive
Painglaive.description:
Upgrades: 1

This fierce but deceptively elegant polearm rips apart enemies with a motor-powered chainsaw blade. An adjustable pulse trigger allows the wielder to channel extra pain through the weapon.

Phase Cutlass.name: Phase Cutlass
Phase Cutlass.description:
Upgrades: 1

A phase cutlass resembles a traditional curved sword until it is powered. Then its blade morphs into a shimmering void, dotted with a tiny new star for each life it ends.

Phase Shield.name: Phase Shield
Phase Shield.description: A phase shield is an intricate but durable technological device worn strapped to a limb that projects a protective hardlight barrier when deployed. Phase shields are translucent and tinted, with fully customizable colors and image projectors. Many wielders choose an image of a celebrity, a loved one, or pleasant scenery to bolster their spirits in dire situations.

Photon Solarian Crystal (Commercial).name: Photon Solarian Crystal (Commercial)
Photon Solarian Crystal (Commercial).description: A photon crystal increases the flow of photons from your solar mote into your solar weapon, burning and blinding your foes. When you hit a creature with your solar weapon while photon attuned, you deal an extra 1d6 fire damage. On a critical hit while you're photon attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Photon Solarian Crystal (Tactical).name: Photon Solarian Crystal (Tactical)
Photon Solarian Crystal (Tactical).description: A photon crystal increases the flow of photons from your solar mote into your solar weapon, burning and blinding your foes. When you hit a creature with your solar weapon while photon attuned, you deal an extra 1d6 fire damage. Damage dealt by your solar weapon while photon attuned ignores the target’s resistance to fire. On a critical hit while you're photon attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 2 rounds.

Photosynthetic Skin.name: Photosynthetic Skin
Photosynthetic Skin.description: Specialized nanites enhance your natural surface cells, allowing them to convert solar radiation into nourishment for your body. You don't need to eat, and you are never @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} as a result of hunger or starvation as long as you spend at least 1 hour per day basking in direct sunlight. You can bask as part of a normal 8-hour rest period.

Plasma Cannon.name: Plasma Cannon
Plasma Cannon.description:
Upgrades: 1

This heavy, long-barreled weapon shoots charges of ionized gas that explode in a blast of superheated plasma.

Plasma Caster.name: Plasma Caster
Plasma Caster.description:
Upgrades: 1

This compact pistol shoots balls of condensed plasma. Holding down the trigger and safety clip at the same time results in the barrel storing more superheated gas than intended, firing a more powerful blast of plasma in what is commonly referred to as “cooking the caster”.

Plasma Doshko.name: Plasma Doshko
Plasma Doshko.description:
Upgrades: 1

Unlike a traditional doshko, this poleaxe uses blades of magnetically stabilized plasma that spin to cleave through multiple enemies with ease.

Plasma Sword.name: Plasma Sword
Plasma Sword.description:
Upgrades: 1

This sword generates a focused beam of plasma around a localized force field powered by a generator in the sword’s hilt. The beam only blazes to life when the sword is powered.

Polyglove.name: Polyglove
Polyglove.description:
Upgrades: 1

This glove features dozens of delicate tools for building or repairing computers and other technological items, making it impossible to manipulate other items in the same hand. Overclocking the polyglove’s components generates voltage between a wielder’s fingertips.

Portable Amp.name: Portable Amp
Portable Amp.description: This small device is typically synced up to an instrument, microphone, or the audio playback on a datapad. It amplifies the audio volume, reducing the DC of Perception checks to hear the audio by 5.

Prehensile Tail (Advanced).name: Prehensile Tail (Advanced)
Prehensile Tail (Advanced).description:
You have a long tail attached to the base of your spine, or another suitable location on your body, improving your overall balance and climbing ability. You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks and Athletics checks to Climb. Using your tail, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} even when your hands are otherwise occupied or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Your tail counts as one free hand for purposes of meeting the requirements to Climb, allowing you to Climb with one free hand plus your prehensile tail.

When you roll a failure on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

Prehensile Tail (Commercial).name: Prehensile Tail (Commercial)
Prehensile Tail (Commercial).description: You have a long tail attached to the base of your spine, or another suitable location on your body, improving your overall balance and climbing ability. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks and Athletics checks to Climb. Using your tail, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} even when your hands are otherwise occupied or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Prehensile Tail (Superior).name: Prehensile Tail (Superior)
Prehensile Tail (Superior).description:
You have a long tail attached to the base of your spine, or another suitable location on your body, improving your overall balance and climbing ability. You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics and Athletics checks. Using your tail, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} even when your hands are otherwise occupied or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Your tail counts as one free hand for purposes of meeting the requirements to Climb, allowing you to Climb with one free hand plus your prehensile tail.

When you roll a failure on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

Prehensile Tail (Tactical).name: Prehensile Tail (Tactical)
Prehensile Tail (Tactical).description:
You have a long tail attached to the base of your spine, or another suitable location on your body, improving your overall balance and climbing ability. You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks and Athletics checks to Climb. Using your tail, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} even when your hands are otherwise occupied or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

Your tail counts as one free hand for purposes of meeting the requirements to Climb, allowing you to Climb with one free hand plus your prehensile tail.

Presence Intensifier.name: Presence Intensifier
Presence Intensifier.description:
This augmentation strengthens your personality, intensifying the parts of you that form the core of your identity. You gain a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy and Intimidation checks. A presence intensifier produces minor cosmetic effects in a small space around you, such as tiny sparkling holograms or wispy shadows, based on your personality. You can activate or deactivate these cosmetics with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. When you get this augmentation, you either increase your Charisma modifier by 1 or increase it to +4, whichever would give you a higher value.

Activate—Irresistible Idea 2 (concentrate)

Frequency once per hour

Effect You manipulate your cosmetics to influence a creature with the effects of a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H] (DC 38).

Programmer's Plushie (Advanced).name: Programmer's Plushie (Advanced)
Programmer's Plushie (Advanced).description:
These miniatures come in every shape, often resembling a programmer's personal avatar or a popular media character, such as Captain Concierge. The plushie helps organize your thoughts, giving you a +3 item bonus to Computers checks.

Activate—Secret Password 2 (auditory)

Effect You whisper a secret passcode known only to yourself and your programmer's plushie, securing a computer, container, door, or lock from intrusion as a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr] with a DC of 35. Any creature can bypass this lock using the passcode while touching the target with the programmer's plushie.

Programmer's Plushie (Commercial).name: Programmer's Plushie (Commercial)
Programmer's Plushie (Commercial).description:
These miniatures come in every shape, often resembling a programmer's personal avatar or a popular media character, such as Captain Concierge. The plushie helps organize your thoughts, giving you a +1 item bonus to Computers checks.

Activate—Secret Password 2 (auditory)

Effect You whisper a secret passcode known only to yourself and your programmer's plushie, securing a computer, container, door, or lock from intrusion as a 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr] with a DC of 18. Any creature can bypass this lock using the passcode while touching the target with the programmer's plushie.

Programmer's Plushie (Tactical).name: Programmer's Plushie (Tactical)
Programmer's Plushie (Tactical).description:
These miniatures come in every shape, often resembling a programmer's personal avatar or a popular media character, such as Captain Concierge. The plushie helps organize your thoughts, giving you a +2 item bonus to Computers checks.

Activate—Secret Password 2 (auditory)

Effect You whisper a secret passcode known only to yourself and your programmer's plushie, securing a computer, container, door, or lock from intrusion as a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Azoh0BSoCASrA1lr] with a DC of 25. Any creature can bypass this lock using the passcode while touching the target with the programmer's plushie.

Prosthetic Limb.name: Prosthetic Limb
Prosthetic Limb.description: This prosthesis replaces a missing or damaged limb. Prosthetic limbs are common augmentations on many worlds and come in many different materials and sizes. The augmentation restores functionality, including the ability to install other augmentations in the limb, but it is no more durable than and doesn't otherwise function differently from the replaced limb. A prosthetic limb can replace one you've lost, or you can have a limb removed to replace it with a prosthetic. Prosthetic limbs don't count toward your implant limit.

Psychoactive Eyes (Commercial).name: Psychoactive Eyes (Commercial)
Psychoactive Eyes (Commercial).description:
Your irises are injected with nanite-activated psychoactive dyes. You can activate these dyes to entrance those you look upon, with varying effects depending on the item's type.

Activate—Gaze 2 (concentrate, mental, visual)

Frequency once per day

Effect You focus your eyes on a creature that can see you within 30 feet. The creature attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:17] saving throw with the following results.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated for as long as it can see you. Taking a hostile action against the creature ends the effect.

Psychoactive Eyes (Tactical).name: Psychoactive Eyes (Tactical)
Psychoactive Eyes (Tactical).description:
Your irises are injected with nanite-activated psychoactive dyes. You can activate these dyes to entrance those you look upon, with varying effects depending on the item's type.

Activate—Gaze 2 (concentrate, incapacitation, mental, visual)

Frequency once per day

Effect You focus your eyes on a creature that can see you within 30 feet. The creature attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:20] saving throw with the following results.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature's attitude becomes friendly towards you for 1 hour or until you use a hostile action against it. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The creature's attitude becomes helpful toward you for 1 hour or until you use a hostile action against it. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Pulse Gauntlet.name: Pulse Gauntlet
Pulse Gauntlet.description:
Upgrades: 1

Popularized in underground fighting circles, this heavy-duty nanocarbon glove amplifies and weaponizes sounds made by its wielder, generating a sonic boom strong enough to knock an enemy off their feet.

Pulsecaster Pistol.name: Pulsecaster Pistol
Pulsecaster Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This imposing pistol fires a jolt of paralyzing electricity from its barrel. Its remaining charges are visible as glowing lines of energy radiating down its body. Pulsecaster pistols are often used by bounty hunters and law enforcement who need to keep their targets alive.

Puzzleblade.name: Puzzleblade
Puzzleblade.description:
Upgrades: 1

This kasathan sword breaks down into interlocking pieces for both storage and transport. Traditionalists practice the art of ritually assembling puzzleblades, with different pieces symbolizing the kasathan virtues of conviction, dedication, moderation, and tradition. Criminals and smugglers value the puzzleblade for its discreet design.

Quick Release Sheath.name: Quick Release Sheath
Quick Release Sheath.description: This articulated compartment installed in your armor can hold an item of no more than light Bulk. You gain a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks and DCs to hide or conceal an item stored inside a quick release sheath, though the sheath provides no protection against magic or other methods that might detect the item. You can Interact to retrieve or stow the item from the sheath normally.

Quicklock.name: Quicklock
Quicklock.description: A quicklock weapon has multiple tracking devices and additional computer processors to increase the rapidity of its built-in targeting systems, allowing its wielder to strike rapidly. While wielding a quicklock weapon, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the weapon.

Quilted Armor.name: Quilted Armor
Quilted Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

This armor is made of layered fabrics stitched together and is popular with scavengers. On Akiton, some suits of quilted armor are actually constructed of heirloom blankets and garments repurposed for protection.

Radiation Buffer (Advanced).name: Radiation Buffer (Advanced)
Radiation Buffer (Advanced).description: This armor upgrade is a layer of treated lead lining your armor. While you're wearing armor with this upgrade, you gain poison resistance 10 against damage from radiation effects and a +3 status bonus to Fortitude saves against radiation.

Radiation Buffer (Commercial).name: Radiation Buffer (Commercial)
Radiation Buffer (Commercial).description: This armor upgrade is a layer of treated lead lining your armor. While you're wearing armor with this upgrade, you gain poison resistance 2 against damage from radiation effects and a +1 status bonus to Fortitude saves against radiation.

Radiation Buffer (Superior).name: Radiation Buffer (Superior)
Radiation Buffer (Superior).description: This armor upgrade is a layer of treated lead lining your armor. While you're wearing armor with this upgrade, you gain poison resistance 12 against damage from radiation effects and a +4 status bonus to Fortitude saves against radiation.

Radiation Buffer (Tactical).name: Radiation Buffer (Tactical)
Radiation Buffer (Tactical).description: This armor upgrade is a layer of treated lead lining your armor. While you're wearing armor with this upgrade, you gain poison resistance 4 against damage from radiation effects and a +2 status bonus to Fortitude saves against radiation.

Radiation Sweeper.name: Radiation Sweeper
Radiation Sweeper.description: This handheld device is capable of detecting radiation within 120 feet. When you Interact with the device, it emits pings in different tones to indicate the presence of low, medium, high, or severe radiation. It also displays the areas of radiation on a simple screen. It automatically updates the data as you move until the beginning of your next turn. After that, you must Interact with the device again to conduct another sweep. A radiation sweeper can't detect radiation through 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force field.

Reaction Breacher.name: Reaction Breacher
Reaction Breacher.description:
Upgrades: 1

This portable reaction cannon launches flak from miniature cluster missiles that can rip through a fortified structure and anyone unfortunate enough to be inside.

Regenerative Rune Splice.name: Regenerative Rune Splice
Regenerative Rune Splice.description:
Your genes are enchanted with microscopic runes that you can activate to recover from traumatic injury.

Activate—Regenerate 2 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain the effects of a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.spells.Item.6koMxltOVtV6BT6U]{Genetic Regeneration} spell.

Repair Toolkit (Commercial).name: Repair Toolkit (Commercial)
Repair Toolkit (Commercial).description: A repair toolkit contains a variety of delicate tools and supplies that allows you to perform simple repairs while traveling. You can use a repair toolkit to Repair items using the Crafting skill. A tactical repair toolkit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check. You can draw and replace a worn repair toolkit as part of the action that uses it.

Repair Toolkit (Tactical).name: Repair Toolkit (Tactical)
Repair Toolkit (Tactical).description: A repair toolkit contains a variety of delicate tools and supplies that allows you to perform simple repairs while traveling. You can use a repair toolkit to Repair items using the Crafting skill. A tactical repair toolkit gives you a +1 item bonus to the check. You can draw and replace a worn repair toolkit as part of the action that uses it.

Resist Energy Spell Amp (Advanced).name: Resist Energy Spell Amp (Advanced)
Resist Energy Spell Amp (Advanced).description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n] spell

Resist Energy Spell Amp (Commercial).name: Resist Energy Spell Amp (Commercial)
Resist Energy Spell Amp (Commercial).description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n] spell

Resist Energy Spell Amp (Tactical).name: Resist Energy Spell Amp (Tactical)
Resist Energy Spell Amp (Tactical).description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n] spell

Retinal Reflectors.name: Retinal Reflectors
Retinal Reflectors.description: These sheets of reflective material, implanted behind the retina, enhance your vision without changing your appearance. You gain low-light vision and a +1 item bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} if they involve sight.

Retrieval Boosters.name: Retrieval Boosters
Retrieval Boosters.description: When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, a complex combination of stabilizers and boosters propels it back into your free hand (or other appendage) after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

Reusable Grenade Shell.name: Reusable Grenade Shell
Reusable Grenade Shell.description:
This ordinance was originally shaped like a brutaris ball and intended to add both visual effects and additional risk to the already dangerous game. You can throw the shell to explode the installed grenade, using the grenade's range, damage, and other effects. The shell remains and repairs the grenade over the course of 24 hours, during which time you can't install another grenade. The shell is too large to fit in a grenade launcher.

Activate—Install Grenade 1 (manipulate)

You install a commercial, tactical, or advanced grenade in the shell. You can store one grenade in the shell at a time, and you can Interact to retrieve the grenade normally.

Riot Shield.name: Riot Shield
Riot Shield.description: Riot shields are constructed from sheets of transparent aluminum reinforced with nanocarbon panels layered over polymers or resins. These sleek shields are designed to protect most of the wielder's body when raised while allowing them to march in tight tactical formations.

Rotolaser.name: Rotolaser
Rotolaser.description:
Upgrades: 1

A rotolaser fires multiple beams of plasma at once. This massive assault rifle has a precisely engineered set of rotating barrels that prevent overheating when spewing auto-fire.

Scattergun.name: Scattergun
Scattergun.description:
Upgrades: 1

A scattergun is a long-barreled firearm that fires numerous spherical projectiles to hit multiple targets at short distances.

Screamer.name: Screamer
Screamer.description:
Upgrades: 1

Resembling a large directional speaker held in two hands, a screamer produces a deafening rush of sound loud enough to shatter glass and rupture eardrums. At lower volumes, a screamer functions as a portable loudspeaker

Second Skin.name: Second Skin
Second Skin.description:
Upgrades: 0

Soft but resilient fabric contours perfectly to the wearer's body, offering basic protection without sacrificing comfort. Second skin is commonly worn underneath casual clothing.

Seeker Rifle.name: Seeker Rifle
Seeker Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This single-shot sniper rifle is one of the most popular weapons in the Vast thanks to its stability and reliability with minimal upkeep.

Semi-Auto Pistol.name: Semi-Auto Pistol
Semi-Auto Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This basic pistol automatically ejects used cartridges and loads new ammunition after every shot fired.

Serrated Missile (Advanced).name: Serrated Missile (Advanced)
Serrated Missile (Advanced).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(2[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:20]).

Serrated Missile (Commercial).name: Serrated Missile (Commercial)
Serrated Missile (Commercial).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[1d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(1[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:15]).

Serrated Missile (Elite).name: Serrated Missile (Elite)
Serrated Missile (Elite).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[4d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(4[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:40]).

Serrated Missile (Paragon).name: Serrated Missile (Paragon)
Serrated Missile (Paragon).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[5d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(5[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:80]).

Serrated Missile (Superior).name: Serrated Missile (Superior)
Serrated Missile (Superior).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[3d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(3[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:30]).

Serrated Missile (Tactical).name: Serrated Missile (Tactical)
Serrated Missile (Tactical).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(2[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:15]).

Serrated Missile (Ultimate).name: Serrated Missile (Ultimate)
Serrated Missile (Ultimate).description:
Ammunition missile launcher

Upon impacting its initial target, the missile unleashes six rapidly spinning blades that slice apart in a line that continues from the location of the target.

It deals @Damage[4d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[(4[splash])[slashing]] (@Template[type:line|distance:60]).

Sharpshooter Serum (Commercial).name: Sharpshooter Serum (Commercial)
Sharpshooter Serum (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This smoky orange liquid allows your gun Strikes to reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 1 for 5 minutes.

Sharpshooter Serum (Tactical).name: Sharpshooter Serum (Tactical)
Sharpshooter Serum (Tactical).description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This smoky orange liquid allows your gun Strikes to reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 2 for 5 minutes.

Shielding Skin (Advanced).name: Shielding Skin (Advanced)
Shielding Skin (Advanced).description: Your skin is biologically engineered to protect your entire body, including your brain, from harmful effects. You gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.

Shielding Skin (Commercial).name: Shielding Skin (Commercial)
Shielding Skin (Commercial).description: Your skin is biologically engineered to protect your entire body, including your brain, from harmful effects. You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

Shielding Skin (Tactical).name: Shielding Skin (Tactical)
Shielding Skin (Tactical).description: Your skin is biologically engineered to protect your entire body, including your brain, from harmful effects. You gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Shimmerstone Serum.name: Shimmerstone Serum
Shimmerstone Serum.description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This iridescent blue tincture is distilled from shimmerstone crystals mined on Vesk-7. You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against mental effects and a +2 item bonus to checks made to Recall Knowledge for 10 minutes.

Shirren-eye Rifle.name: Shirren-eye Rifle
Shirren-eye Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This sniper rifle equips a compound technological scope that allows snipers to adjust focus and magnification with natural eye movements instead of using moving parts that might disrupt their aim.

Shock Module (Commercial).name: Shock Module (Commercial)
Shock Module (Commercial).description: This deceptively simple upgrade safely courses electricity through your weapon, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

Shock Module (Tactical).name: Shock Module (Tactical)
Shock Module (Tactical).description:
This deceptively simple upgrade safely courses electricity through your weapon, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

Electricity damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s electricity resistance (and the other creatures’ on a critical hit).

Shock Pad.name: Shock Pad
Shock Pad.description:
Upgrades: 1

This flexible nanocarbon circuit can be installed as an upgrade into gloves, kneepads, or similar appendage protectors to emit a powerful electric shock when forcefully applied to a target.

Shock Truncheon.name: Shock Truncheon
Shock Truncheon.description:
Upgrades: 1

Popular among security forces, this retractable baton discharges electricity when it strikes a target. A whirring device inside the grip generates voltage, creating a sound like a swarm of buzzing insects when it’s fully charged.

Shooting Starknife.name: Shooting Starknife
Shooting Starknife.description:
Upgrades: 1

This traditional star-shaped blade of lost Golarion is often forged from reinforced carbon steel and treated with chemicals that create an iridescent sheen. When properly balanced and honed, a shooting starknife sings as it slices through the air

Shotalashu Armor.name: Shotalashu Armor
Shotalashu Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

Flexible but sturdy plates layered together form this traditional armor worn by lashunta cavalry on Castrovel. In times past, a shotalashu cavalry member forged their armor from their mount's shed skin, or more rarely, the skin of a fallen mount, to honor them in future battles.

Shrink Spell Amp.name: Shrink Spell Amp
Shrink Spell Amp.description:
Known on most worlds as "spell amps", spell ampoules are ready-to-use magic injections that confer the benefits of a spell of the specified rank.

Activate—Inject 1 (manipulate)

Effect 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby] spell

Silencer.name: Silencer
Silencer.description: This metallic cylinder is filled with internal sound baffles to reduce the noise of a firearm. The firearm doesn't make a loud noise when fired. However, creatures hit by the ammunition may still cry out in pain.

Singing Coil.name: Singing Coil
Singing Coil.description:
Upgrades: 1

Resembling a resonant transformer circuit, this stringed instrument produces sound by using high-frequency alternating currents to cause air molecules to vibrate. While most performers play with a magnetized steel bow, some combatants pair the singing coil with a nano-edge rapier.

Singing Spear.name: Singing Spear
Singing Spear.description:
Upgrades: 1

Classically shaped like an oversized musical note, this spear intones melodious pitches when it strikes, creating a new song with each battle. Masters of the singing spear are called composers, and often record their greatest battles as musical compositions.

Skyfire Armor.name: Skyfire Armor
Skyfire Armor.description:
Upgrades: 0

These decorative suits of medium armor feature exaggerated shoulder guards, stylized dragon wings, and Skyfire logos across the breastplate's back and chest, and are often plated with gold or other attractive metals. Typical Skyfire armor sacrifices upgrade space for style.

Skyfire Sword.name: Skyfire Sword
Skyfire Sword.description:
Upgrades: 1

Famously wielded by warriors of the Skyfire Legion, this flaming blade is powered by burning gas held in place by magnetic fields.

Smoke Grenade (Advanced).name: Smoke Grenade (Advanced)
Smoke Grenade (Advanced).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smoke Grenade (Commercial).name: Smoke Grenade (Commercial)
Smoke Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smoke Grenade (Elite).name: Smoke Grenade (Elite)
Smoke Grenade (Elite).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:25]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smoke Grenade (Paragon).name: Smoke Grenade (Paragon)
Smoke Grenade (Paragon).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:40]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smoke Grenade (Superior).name: Smoke Grenade (Superior)
Smoke Grenade (Superior).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smoke Grenade (Tactical).name: Smoke Grenade (Tactical)
Smoke Grenade (Tactical).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smoke Grenade (Ultimate).name: Smoke Grenade (Ultimate)
Smoke Grenade (Ultimate).description:
Activate 1 @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire}

This grenade unleashes a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30]. Creatures within the area have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dissipated by a strong wind or similar effect.

Smuggler's Grip (Commercial).name: Smuggler's Grip (Commercial)
Smuggler's Grip (Commercial).description: These grips are designed to make it easy to conceal your weapon and are frequently used by detectives, smugglers, and those exploring uncontacted planets who don't want to appear hostile. The weapon gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} trait.

Smuggler's Grip (Tactical).name: Smuggler's Grip (Tactical)
Smuggler's Grip (Tactical).description: A tactical @UUID[Compendium.starfinder-field-test-for-pf2e.equipment.Item.O0cuj6CI1GzAVPke]{Smuggler's Grip} is a hybrid item with the extradimensional, magical, and tech traits. You can pull the weapon into an extradimensional space as an Interact action, leaving behind a palm-sized disk, granting you a +4 item bonus to your Stealth check to Conceal the Object. You can't draw the weapon while it's in the extradimensional space, but you can use an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} action to retrieve it.

Sniper's Scope (Advanced).name: Sniper's Scope (Advanced)
Sniper's Scope (Advanced).description:
You can use a telescopic sighting attachment to help aim at enemies who are far away.

The scope grants you a +2 item bonus to visual Perception checks to Seek creatures through the scope.

Activate—Adjust Sight 1 (manipulate)

Effect Increase the range increment of the weapon the scope is attached to by 20 feet. If the weapon has a base range increment of 50 feet or more, increase the range of the weapon by 40 feet instead. This lasts until the beginning of your next turn or until you're no longer wielding the weapon this scope is attached to, whichever comes first. This does not increase the size of area attacks.

Sniper's Scope (Commercial).name: Sniper's Scope (Commercial)
Sniper's Scope (Commercial).description:
You can use a telescopic sighting attachment to help aim at enemies who are far away.

Activate—Adjust Sight 1 (manipulate)

Effect Increase the range increment of the weapon the scope is attached to by 10 feet. If the weapon has a base range increment of 50 feet or more, increase the range of the weapon by 20 feet instead. This lasts until the beginning of your next turn or until you're no longer wielding the weapon this scope is attached to, whichever comes first. This does not increase the size of area attacks.

Sniper's Scope (Superior).name: Sniper's Scope (Superior)
Sniper's Scope (Superior).description:
You can use a telescopic sighting attachment to help aim at enemies who are far away.

The scope grants you a +3 item bonus to visual Perception checks to Seek creatures through the scope.

Activate—Adjust Sight 1 (manipulate)

Effect Increase the range increment of the weapon the scope is attached to by 40 feet. If the weapon has a base range increment of 50 feet or more, increase the range of the weapon by 80 feet instead. This lasts until the beginning of your next turn or until you're no longer wielding the weapon this scope is attached to, whichever comes first. This does not increase the size of area attacks.

Sniper's Scope (Tactical).name: Sniper's Scope (Tactical)
Sniper's Scope (Tactical).description:
You can use a telescopic sighting attachment to help aim at enemies who are far away.

The scope grants you a +1 item bonus to visual Perception checks to Seek creatures through the scope.

Activate—Adjust Sight 1 (manipulate)

Effect Increase the range increment of the weapon the scope is attached to by 10 feet. If the weapon has a base range increment of 50 feet or more, increase the range of the weapon by 20 feet instead. This lasts until the beginning of your next turn or until you're no longer wielding the weapon this scope is attached to, whichever comes first. This does not increase the size of area attacks.

Sonic Rifle.name: Sonic Rifle
Sonic Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

This short, sleek rifle features a uniquely efficient yet elegant design. A sonic rifle creates a narrow beam of ultrasound that effectively turns whatever it hits into a speaker, breaking its targets apart with hypersonic vibrations.

Speed Suspension (Advanced).name: Speed Suspension (Advanced)
Speed Suspension (Advanced).description: High-performance cybernetics replace the joints and tendons in your legs. This speed suspension completely replaces your legs with cybernetics and increases your land Speed by 15 feet. This is an item bonus.

Speed Suspension (Commercial).name: Speed Suspension (Commercial)
Speed Suspension (Commercial).description: High-performance cybernetics replace the joints and tendons in your legs. This speed suspension replaces only a few parts, increasing your land Speed by 5 feet. This is an item bonus.

Speed Suspension (Tactical).name: Speed Suspension (Tactical)
Speed Suspension (Tactical).description: High-performance cybernetics replace the joints and tendons in your legs. This speed suspension is more invasive and increases your land Speed by 10 feet. This is an item bonus.

Spell Chip (1st-Rank Spell).name: Spell Chip (1st-Rank Spell)
Spell Chip (1st-Rank Spell).description:
Usage installed in computer or comm unit

These chips can be installed in computers and comm units to allow the device to cast spells. Each device can have only one spell chip. Casting a spell from a spell chip requires holding the computer or comm unit in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell. The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell is of your spellcasting tradition. If the spell has a locus, you must still have that locus to cast the spell from a spell chip. Spell chips can't contain cantrips or rituals. The traits for this item vary based on the spell it contains.

In addition to the charge expended to Cast the Spell, the delicate components that make up the core lattice of a spell chip can be destroyed if used in quick succession. Attempting to use a spell chip more than once per day requires overclocking it. Cast the Spell again, then roll a @Check[type:flat|dc:10]. On a success, the spell chip is broken. On a failure, the spell chip is destroyed. If anyone tries to overclock a spell chip that's already been overclocked that day, the spell chip is automatically destroyed (even if it has been repaired) and no spell is cast. You can reprogram a destroyed spell chip by buying or Crafting a virtual spell chip that has the same cost as a spell gem of the same level and the virtual trait. If not installed on a destroyed spell chip, a virtual spell chip in a computer can be activated only in virtual reality.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Casting a spell from a spell chip requires holding the computer or comm unit in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell. The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell is of your spellcasting tradition. If the spell has a locus, you must still have that locus to cast the spell from a spell chip. Spell chips can't contain cantrips or rituals. The traits for this item vary based on the spell it contains.

In addition to the charge expended to Cast the Spell, the delicate components that make up the core lattice of a spell chip can be destroyed if used in quick succession. Attempting to use a spell chip more than once per day requires overclocking it. Cast the Spell again, then roll a @Check[type:flat|dc:10]. On a success, the spell chip is broken. On a failure, the spell chip is destroyed. If anyone tries to overclock a spell chip that's already been overclocked that day, the spell chip is automatically destroyed (even if it has been repaired) and no spell is cast. You can reprogram a destroyed spell chip by buying or Crafting a virtual spell chip that has the same cost as a spell gem of the same level and the virtual trait. If not installed on a destroyed spell chip, a virtual spell chip in a computer can be activated only in virtual reality.

Activate Cast a Spell
