Spell Gem (10th-rank spell).name: Spell Gem (10th-rank spell)
Spell Gem (10th-rank spell).description:
These latticed gemstones are suspended in a silicon casing and encoded with the magical script necessary to cast a single, specific spell. Casting a spell from a spell gem requires holding the gem in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell. The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell is of your spellcasting tradition. The spell in a spell gem can be cast only once, and the spell gem is destroyed as part of the casting. Spell gems can't contain cantrips or rituals. The traits for this item vary based on the spell it contains.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated

Sprayflesh.name: Sprayflesh
Sprayflesh.description:
This single-use sterile canister sprays neutral biomass into a wound or area of concern (such as a clearly diseased or poisoned section of the body).

Activate—Spray 1 (manipulate)

Effect You apply sprayflesh to an injury. For 1 hour, or until the creature fully recovers to their maximum Hit Points, you can attempt Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} on the target creature even if they're temporarily immune to Treat Wounds.

Starfall Pistol.name: Starfall Pistol
Starfall Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

While the original shooting star pistol was a kit-bashed plasma caster, the commercial models reliably fire deadly streams of superheated plasma. Akitonian revelers enjoy discharging these pistols at outdoor celebrations.

Stellar Blast Solarian Crystal.name: Stellar Blast Solarian Crystal
Stellar Blast Solarian Crystal.description: Stellar blast crystals channel your solar energy into the point of impact when you attack, creating a small explosion. While you're attuned, Strikes with your solar weapon or solar shot deal splash damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice. This is bludgeoning damage if you're graviton attuned or fire damage if you're photon attuned. You're immune to this splash damage.

Stellar Cannon.name: Stellar Cannon
Stellar Cannon.description:
Upgrades: 1

The rounds of this portable cannon are loaded with carefully positioned mini-missiles packed with flechettes that shred anyone too close to the epicenter of the blast. Spray from a stellar cannon creates a swarm of dazzling sparks that is often compared to fireworks or shooting stars

Streetsweeper.name: Streetsweeper
Streetsweeper.description:
Upgrades: 1

This enormous portable cannon is equipped with speakers that broadcast dense ultrasonic waves powerful enough to sweep a street clean of anything in its path.

Striking Solarian Crystal (Advanced).name: Striking Solarian Crystal (Advanced)
Striking Solarian Crystal (Advanced).description: This gem contains the condensed matter of a star, useful in enhancing the stellar connection of a solarian. This increases the weapon damage dice of a solar weapon to four instead of one.

Striking Solarian Crystal (Commercial).name: Striking Solarian Crystal (Commercial)
Striking Solarian Crystal (Commercial).description: This gem contains the condensed matter of a star, useful in enhancing the stellar connection of a solarian. This increases the weapon damage dice of a solar weapon to two instead of one.

Striking Solarian Crystal (Tactical).name: Striking Solarian Crystal (Tactical)
Striking Solarian Crystal (Tactical).description: This gem contains the condensed matter of a star, useful in enhancing the stellar connection of a solarian. This increases the weapon damage dice of a solar weapon to three instead of one.

Sunshades (Commercial).name: Sunshades (Commercial)
Sunshades (Commercial).description: Sunshades come in a variety of styles. You gain a +1 item bonus to saves against effects that cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition while wearing tactical sunshades.

Sunshades (Tactical).name: Sunshades (Tactical)
Sunshades (Tactical).description: Sunshades come in a variety of styles. You gain a +1 item bonus to saves against effects that cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition while wearing tactical sunshades.

Swarmsuit.name: Swarmsuit
Swarmsuit.description:
Upgrades: 0

Specialized nanites form a mesh suit that changes to fit wearers with unique or transformable physiologies.

Tailblade.name: Tailblade
Tailblade.description:
Upgrades: 1

Adjustable bands secure this lightweight blade to a tail, tentacle, or similar appendage. Tailblades are often ceremonial and heraldic, with families or orders bequeathing tailblades forged from precious metals or engraved with sacred writing across generations.

Talon.name: Talon
Talon.description:
Upgrades: 1

This stylized knife tapers into a curved and serrated blade. When powered, it spews a highly corrosive acid inspired by the armor-melting talons of several species of the Swarm.

Telepathy Node.name: Telepathy Node
Telepathy Node.description: A rune-carved sphere of treated alloys the size of a pebble is implanted into your brain's communication center. You gain limited telepathy to a range of 30 feet.

Tempweave.name: Tempweave
Tempweave.description:
Upgrades: 1

Tempweave suits are reinforced hooded garments woven with thermal fabric and venting wires, popularly worn for trips to Castrovel's jungles and other humid climates.

Thermal Capacitor (Advanced).name: Thermal Capacitor (Advanced)
Thermal Capacitor (Advanced).description: This armor upgrade regulates heat, protecting you from extreme temperatures. You are protected from extreme cold and extreme heat.

Thermal Capacitor (Commercial).name: Thermal Capacitor (Commercial)
Thermal Capacitor (Commercial).description: This armor upgrade regulates heat, protecting you from extreme temperatures. You are protected from mild cold and mild heat.

Thermal Capacitor (Superior).name: Thermal Capacitor (Superior)
Thermal Capacitor (Superior).description: This armor upgrade regulates heat, protecting you from extreme temperatures. You are protected from incredible cold and incredible heat.

Thermal Capacitor (Tactical).name: Thermal Capacitor (Tactical)
Thermal Capacitor (Tactical).description: This armor upgrade regulates heat, protecting you from extreme temperatures. You are protected from severe cold and severe heat.

Thermal Dynafan.name: Thermal Dynafan
Thermal Dynafan.description:
Upgrades: 1

This warfan is based on a highly modified handheld environmental comfort device. The thermal dynafan rapidly decreases pressure in the air to create a frigid chill. When connected to another dynafan, it can vent the dispersed heat into its twin to create a plume of fire.

Thinplate.name: Thinplate
Thinplate.description:
Upgrades: 1

This sleek but rigid plate armor is often constructed from translucent materials to show off a wearer's dermal circuitry and worn under baggy clothing.

Tracking Bug.name: Tracking Bug
Tracking Bug.description:
This tracking device contains a miniature transponder that helps you follow and locate your quarry. You can hide a tracking bug on a creature with a successful Thievery check to Palm an Object from the creature, but instead of taking an object, you leave the bug somewhere in the creature's possession, such as in their pocket. You can hide a tracking bug on a vehicle or other object with a Stealth check to Conceal an Object; you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to this check due to the tracking bug's size.

Once you plant a tracking bug, you can use a custom app (included in the tracking bug's Price) to follow the tracking bug with a successful Computers check (typically DC appropriate to the level of the threat) using a computer, comm unit, or similar device; the GM should adjust this DC to reflect environmental conditions and other factors. You must be on the same plane and planet as the bug for the app to function. A fully charged tracking bug lasts 1 day. When the bug runs out of power, you can't follow it until you recharge it.

Translocation Braces (Commercial).name: Translocation Braces (Commercial)
Translocation Braces (Commercial).description:
Your limbs are fitted with braces attuned to extraplanar resonance frequencies.

Activate—Transfer Object 2 (concentrate, teleportation)

Frequency once per day

Effect You instantly transfer an object you're holding of up to 1 Bulk to the empty hand of a willing creature within 30 feet.

Translocation Braces (Tactical).name: Translocation Braces (Tactical)
Translocation Braces (Tactical).description:
Your limbs are fitted with braces attuned to extraplanar resonance frequencies.

Activate—Transfer Object 2 (concentrate, teleportation)

Frequency once per day

Effect You instantly transfer an object you're holding of up to 1 Bulk to the empty hand of a willing creature within 30 feet.

Activate—Transfer Self 2 (concentrate, teleportation)

Frequency once per day

Effect You instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to an unoccupied space you can see within 90 feet. The activation fails if this would bring another creature with you, even if it's inside an extradimensional container. This extraplanar transportation disorients you, causing you to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of your next turn.

Truesight Sight (Commercial).name: Truesight Sight (Commercial)
Truesight Sight (Commercial).description:
These specialized lenses are made of crystals specially infused with spells as they are cut. They are then installed into sights that conserve their magical energy with the use of integrated computer imagery. You gain a +1 item bonus to visual Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} when looking through the scope.

Activate—See the Truth 2 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect For the next 10 minutes, while looking through the scope, you can see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures as though they weren't invisible. Additionally, you can see incorporeal creatures, like ghosts, within 10 feet of an object's surface.

Truesight Sight (Tactical).name: Truesight Sight (Tactical)
Truesight Sight (Tactical).description:
These specialized lenses are made of crystals specially infused with spells as they are cut. They are then installed into sights that conserve their magical energy with the use of integrated computer imagery. You gain a +2 item bonus to visual Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} when looking through the scope.

Activate—See the Truth 2 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect For the next 10 minutes, while looking through the scope, you can see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures as though they weren't invisible. Additionally, you can see incorporeal creatures, like ghosts, within 10 feet of an object's surface.

When you activate See the Truth, you see the truth of the world. The GM rolls a secret counteract check with a +20 counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 7 against any illusion, morph, or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it, not to end the spell or effect.

Ultralight Wings (Advanced).name: Ultralight Wings (Advanced)
Ultralight Wings (Advanced).description: Foldable wings are attached to your shoulder blades, or a similar location on your body that allows them to lift your weight and control your flying movements. You can deploy the wings by spending a single Interact action, though you can't deploy or use them while you're wearing more than light armor. While the wings are deployed and you're not encumbered, you gain a fly Speed of 40 feet and a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight.

Ultralight Wings (Commercial).name: Ultralight Wings (Commercial)
Ultralight Wings (Commercial).description: Foldable wings are attached to your shoulder blades, or a similar location on your body that allows them to lift your weight and control your flying movements. You can deploy the wings by spending a single Interact action, though you can't deploy or use them while you're wearing more than light armor. While the wings are deployed and you're not encumbered, you gain a fly Speed of 20 feet and a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight.

Ultralight Wings (Superior).name: Ultralight Wings (Superior)
Ultralight Wings (Superior).description: Foldable wings are attached to your shoulder blades, or a similar location on your body that allows them to lift your weight and control your flying movements. You can deploy the wings by spending a single Interact action, though you can't deploy or use them while you're wearing more than light armor. While the wings are deployed and you're not encumbered, you gain a fly Speed of 60 feet and a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight.

Ultralight Wings (Tactical).name: Ultralight Wings (Tactical)
Ultralight Wings (Tactical).description: Foldable wings are attached to your shoulder blades, or a similar location on your body that allows them to lift your weight and control your flying movements. You can deploy the wings by spending a single Interact action, though you can't deploy or use them while you're wearing more than light armor. While the wings are deployed and you're not encumbered, you gain a fly Speed of 30 feet and a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight.

Undermounted Grenade Launcher (Advanced).name: Undermounted Grenade Launcher (Advanced)
Undermounted Grenade Launcher (Advanced).description:
This bracket-mounted grenade launcher is most often advertised for use with fragmentation grenades, but many military and law enforcement officers use this attachment to efficiently deploy utility ordinances such as smoke grenades and flashbangs. Unlike a dedicated grenade launcher, it takes ten minutes to load an undermounted grenade launcher, reassembling the grenade into ammunition by mounting it on a specialized reusable firing cap. Once a grenade has been loaded, it can only be safely removed by disassembling the entire grenade, destroying it in the process.

This grenade launcher has a range of 40 feet.

Activate—Launch 1 (attack)

Effect You launch the loaded grenade.

Uniclamp.name: Uniclamp
Uniclamp.description: This is the ultimate all-purpose accessory item for holding everything from a fire extinguisher or flashlight to a musical instrument or comm unit. You can securely attach a single piece of tech gear of up to 1 Bulk to a uniclamp when you install the upgrade. You can activate the attached item using the same number of hands you use to wield your weapon, while still wielding your weapon. The uniclamp can be properly configured to handle only non-magical tech gear and doesn't function with weapons or shields. The GM might determine that some items don't fit on certain weapons.

Venom Spur.name: Venom Spur
Venom Spur.description: A retractable spur attached to one of your appendages delivers a poisonous sting. You gain a venom spur unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing plus 1d4 persistent poison damage. Your venom spur is in the brawling group and has the finesse, poison, and unarmed traits.

Vesk Scales.name: Vesk Scales
Vesk Scales.description: Your ancestors were the hardiest specimens of vesk, having traveled far and wide while enduring hostile environments. Your scales count as medium armor in the plate armor group that grant a +4 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of +1, a check penalty of –2, and a Strength threshold of +3, and has the comfort trait. You can wear a flight suit but can't wear other armor. You can etch armor runes onto your scales, but you can't install armor upgrades.

Veskarium Imperial Plate.name: Veskarium Imperial Plate
Veskarium Imperial Plate.description:
Upgrades: 1

This heavy armor is made of interlocking metal plates contoured to the wearer's body with a scalelike pattern. Tailguards and clawed gloves are standard for this armor.

Vocal Modulator.name: Vocal Modulator
Vocal Modulator.description: A series of miniature actuators and dynamic hyper-resonant chambers reshape your voice box. A vocal modulator allows you to change the pitch, timbre, and tone of your voice so you can imitate accents or pronounce alien languages. When using Deception to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate}, you gain a +1 item bonus if the change in your voice also helps your disguise (at the GM's discretion).

Voice Amplifier.name: Voice Amplifier
Voice Amplifier.description: A voice amplifier greatly increases the volume of your voice. You can switch a voice amplifier on or off by spending an action, which has the concentrate trait. While active, a voice amplifier grants you a +1 item bonus to Intimidation checks and lowers the DCs of other creatures' Perception checks to hear you speaking by 5.

Voice Distorter.name: Voice Distorter
Voice Distorter.description: This device, when held in front of the mouth of someone speaking, distorts their voice into something obviously artificial and unrecognizable. Any check attempted to identify the wearer's voice takes a –2 circumstance penalty. A character who has a recording of a distorted voice can attempt a Computers check against the Deception DC of the target to remove the distortion, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to the check if they have access to an undistorted sample of the same voice.

Wildwise Graft.name: Wildwise Graft
Wildwise Graft.description: This soft purple fungus attaches to your vocal cords and extends fine filaments into portions of your brain. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals, plants, and fungi. This communication is rudimentary, eliciting basic responses such as "hungry," "over there," or "frightened."

Zero Cannon.name: Zero Cannon
Zero Cannon.description:
Upgrades: 1

This triple-barreled cannon’s generator churns rapidly, circulating coolant into a blast of endothermic energy. While powered, frost rimes the barrel and stock of this weapon, causing experienced wielders to keep thermal gloves on hand.

Zero Knife.name: Zero Knife
Zero Knife.description:
Upgrades: 1

Unfolding like a switchblade, a supercooled chamber within this weapon’s grip instantly forms a blade of ice with an aura of intense cold.

Zero Pistol.name: Zero Pistol
Zero Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

Zero pistols typically have transparent canisters that reveal current charge levels as blue, supercooled liquid, though some models have switched to digital monitoring. The original zero pistol was a weaponized coolant gun according to urban legend.
